comments.body: [~accountid:557058:4220c62a-5a45-4184-9d96-222257e39e44] This issue is blocking the overdue Kalundborg Refinery migration. R&D is developing persistent login and encoder touch to cover this migration (and others) but without fixing this touch issue, migration will not happen and prioritization is in vain. Please pick this up in the CTRL PQM and prioritize in line with the feature development. Thanks!

[~accountid:640f05acb05b4e3e7da841d8]  As this issue is blocking an OpSpace migration that is planned to be performed using CTRL 1.14, how can it be taken up to have the highest change of making it in the propper CTRL release?

Trying to reproduce using the Touch screen in Luxembourg did reveal that the issue seems to have worsened. The On-Screen keyboard and calculator all show double characters. See screenshot of notepad output and linked video.
[~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867] , can you please have someone from Media team analyze the issue

Would it also be possible to get a more accurate, more general description for KB purposes?
Because the typing of the numbers seems specific to the use case.
What is the specific issue with touch? Touches count double, touches don’t register, I don’t really see a line.

Did we do more in-depth testing?

Kernel event are ok:

{noformat}Event: time 1769607356.663644, type 3 (EV_ABS), code 57 (ABS_MT_TRACKING_ID), value 0
Event: time 1769607356.663644, type 3 (EV_ABS), code 53 (ABS_MT_POSITION_X), value 4468
Event: time 1769607356.663644, type 3 (EV_ABS), code 54 (ABS_MT_POSITION_Y), value 4566
Event: time 1769607356.663644, type 1 (EV_KEY), code 330 (BTN_TOUCH), value 1
Event: time 1769607356.663644, -------------- SYN_REPORT ------------
Event: time 1769607356.829626, type 3 (EV_ABS), code 57 (ABS_MT_TRACKING_ID), value -1
Event: time 1769607356.829626, type 1 (EV_KEY), code 330 (BTN_TOUCH), value 0
Event: time 1769607356.829626, -------------- SYN_REPORT ------------
{noformat}

Always clear individual events, no duplicates.

Inputmanager events are also clean:

{noformat}Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: touch on pci-0000:00:14.0-usb-0:5.3:1.0 down/motion 0 (349.519231, 566.906250) -> (349.519231, 566.906250)
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: TOUCH_DEBUG: [libinput-wrapper] DOWN slot=0 id=0 x=349.52 y=566.91 path=pci-0000:00:14.0-usb-0:5.3:1.0 timestamp=9633542848
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: TOUCH_DEBUG: [input-manager] SEND slot=0 desc=touch mode=0 is_master=1
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: TOUCH_DEBUG: [input-manager] REPLAY slot=0 desc=touch is_master=1 mode=0 will_inject=1
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: TOUCH_DEBUG: [uinput-wrapper] INJECT TOUCH_DOWN slot=0 id=0 raw_pos=(349,566) timestamp=9633542984
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: uw_handle_event touch @(4445, 4662)
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: touch up 0
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: TOUCH_DEBUG: [libinput-wrapper] UP slot=0 timestamp=9633688885
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: TOUCH_DEBUG: [input-manager] SEND slot=0 desc=touch-up mode=0 is_master=1
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: TOUCH_DEBUG: [input-manager] REPLAY slot=0 desc=touch-up is_master=1 mode=0 will_inject=1
Jan 28 14:37:50 san-050-2531225403 barco-input-manager[175668]: TOUCH_DEBUG: [uinput-wrapper] INJECT TOUCH_UP slot=0 timestamp=9633688954
{noformat}

So either something happened with mutter gestures? or we have issues on the wayland cleints.

{noformat}Jan 29 16:45:19 san-050-2531225403 rdp-player[12446]: Touch SDL->HID: FingerDown - finger_id=32, x=730, y=954, timestamp=333510 (res=1920x1080)
Jan 29 16:45:19 san-050-2531225403 rdp-player[12446]: Sending TouchAction to RDP proxy: Pressed at (730, 954), finger_id=32
Jan 29 16:45:19 san-050-2531225403 rdp-player[12446]: Touch SDL->HID: FingerUp - finger_id=32, x=730, y=954, timestamp=333630 (res=1920x1080)
Jan 29 16:45:19 san-050-2531225403 rdp-player[12446]: Sending TouchAction to RDP proxy: Released at (730, 954), finger_id=32
{noformat}

even tough duplicates are filtered out as proof here on rdpplayer only one Down → up event the terminal server still registers 2 keys…

patching freerdp  to disable automatic UPDATE generation for active but non-dirty contacts.

This was causing duplicate touch events to be sent to Windows for simple taps, because the polling thread would generate UPDATE events every 20ms while the contact was active (between DOWN and UP events). Only send events when there's actual new input (dirty contacts).

lets see….

[~accountid:615aa5729cdb93007267f6e4] A few questions

* What triggered this behavior? As this worked before. Is this a new freerdp version that behaves differently
* Is there a chance that this or another update since reported, fixes the behavior of the brief lock-up that causes a tap to ‘land’ on the location of the previous tap resulting in the wrong character being entered? Answering myself: Until tested, we will not know.
* Is this double entry issue present in 1.12 based on the root case analysis? If so then I will not migrate the system to 1.12.

Patching dirty-contacts showed me that the new input was not a touch event, but a mouse event.

My suspicion now is that a single touch generates BOTH touch events AND synthetic mouse events…

Exploring the path now of disabling SDL's automatic generation of mouse events from touch input.
[~accountid:5af5ecb79e3ea106fafab07f] i am writing down the analysis and progress in steps, to have tracability on RCA. I will document RCA and fix if i have reached a conclusion.

somehow we crossed the 20ms polling treshold for SDL to auto send also click with touch event.

rdp-player code is now changed so single touch generates ONLY touch events AND NO synthetic mouse events ever.

fix is holding in LUX [~accountid:5af5ecb79e3ea106fafab07f]
available in {{barco-ctrl_2026.01.30-2347}}
somehow fixversion tag not available in jira.

[~accountid:615aa5729cdb93007267f6e4]I noticed the same. Very annoying. Is it reported to SWiT? As release planning affect project deployment planning, this information (taking reasonable probability into account) can save thousands of euros a day on the deployment cost. A world of dependencies...

fields.description:
h3. Actual behavior

!Keypad.png|width=157,alt="Keypad.png"!

Use case: The customer needs to type critical data on the touch-panel which is showing a RDP-source.

Issue: The entered data is not correct, if typing at a reasonably fast pace: Some characters are entered multiple times, some are missing. Example 1,2,3 becomes 1,1,1,2,3.

Observation: When a key is duplicated, there is also a short visible freeze.

A video showing the effect is attached. 

This issue is an exact copy of a former issue experienced when using the OpSpace Spark Gateway RDP component. it was solved after switching to RDP10. Now it is back in RDP10.

Reference: [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-1084|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-1084|smart-link] 

h3. Occurrence rate

9/10

h3. Workaround (If any)

There is no reliable workaround. Typing slower is not an option. CTRL desk will be flanked by regular thin clients that do not expose this issue. Operators shall not need to make the distinction.

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Make sure to attach relevant artifacts (logs/videos/timestamp)
{panel}

comments.body:
[~accountid:712020:d621ce6b-8dcd-46b9-ae47-1ba119107b49] : What the tentative timeline to fix this? I hope this would plan for MRD 1.11.0

cc:  [~accountid:712020:e059e4aa-65e1-4218-aabc-6970656f34ef] [~accountid:712020:b33591a5-091a-4dca-bf26-45330ee93b71]

This will not be for the 1.11.0 for sure. 
Status update:

The interrupt storm was just the tip of the iceberg since there is a general problem with interrupts on all HDMI ports. I had this narrowed down to a synchronization problem of the incoming pixel clock of the hdmi signal with the reference clock. However what I also found out, very recently that is, is that the branch that was used to start development of the 6.6 kernel didn’t have the latest changes that were done on the 5.15 branch that is still used by the NGSD440. And by latest I mean the last two years apparently. The reason is that the 6.6 was actually started from the 6.1 branch which was a kernel version that never made it on the NGSD440 so all active development still happened on the 5.15 branch for this platform.

I’m now in the process of cherry-picking the missing commits, this needs to happen very carefully step by step. Once this is done we should have a kernel that has all the latest patches and then we should be able to start testing all the functionality with this new kernel.

[~accountid:640f05acb05b4e3e7da841d8] / [~accountid:640f05bf57f0c028e2f3ecf4] : this vulnerability will require another deviation as per the current status quo. Can PO please request a deviation to be approved by PM and provide a planned fix version? Thank you.
cc: [~accountid:712020:b33591a5-091a-4dca-bf26-45330ee93b71] [~accountid:712020:e059e4aa-65e1-4218-aabc-6970656f34ef]

[~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867] , will this make to 1.12? If not, we may need a deviation in 1.12. 

 [~accountid:712020:e7d31fd3-7f23-4a89-b826-ad17642a3886] , why should this need deviation in 1.11 as MRD is planned in Oct and due date is Nov 16th.

[~accountid:640f05acb05b4e3e7da841d8] while deviation is not required for MRD 1.11 itself, it becomes necessary in this case because the fix of this vulnerability is not expected to be included in the MRD within the stipulated timeline

[~accountid:712020:e7d31fd3-7f23-4a89-b826-ad17642a3886] AFAIK, on the day of MRD, if the vulnerability is not passed due date, it does not need deviation. It is still a month out. We may (or maynot) be able to pull 1.12 in that time. So, a deviaition should be required near to its due date.

[~accountid:640f05acb05b4e3e7da841d8] Yes, you’re right. As confirmed in the vulnerability management meeting, the fix won’t make it to MRD 1.12. Just sharing this early so you’re aware a deviation will be needed closer to the due date

[~accountid:712020:e7d31fd3-7f23-4a89-b826-ad17642a3886] Ah, OK. If its not making 1.12, then yes, it requires a deviation.

[~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867] , can you rasie a deviation request.

[~accountid:640f05bf57f0c028e2f3ecf4] we must request another extension for this. Our current estimate for a realistic date of resolution of this issue puts us past the 1.12 timeframe. We are (and have been) working on this issue for because this is a very large item with numerous tendrils in unexpacted places.

Our current best estimate for a resolution of this is somewhere in the beginning of 2025-DEC (provided we continue to get assistance from SuMo - whom we are engaging with on this at this point in time).

[~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867] Understood. Deviation approved. What’s the feasibility to have this included in 1.13?

cc: [~accountid:712020:b33591a5-091a-4dca-bf26-45330ee93b71]
Assuming 1.13 drops around 2025-12-2x, we currently anticipate this feasibility to be reasonable.

[~accountid:640f05bf57f0c028e2f3ecf4] This was something that was going to be fixed by the work that Gert is doing on the kernel bump. We have encountered unforeseen complexity on this and this has been delayed until 26q1.

We have to request a deviation on this one again as well with the intention to fix this in the same bucket as that kernel bump.
[~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867] Deviation approved. Please ensure the vulnerability is resolved within the revised time window.

[~accountid:640f05bf57f0c028e2f3ecf4] [~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867] just to confirm - you are not planning to deliver this before the current due date of {{2026-04-16}}? Only then another deviation would be required.

[~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867][~accountid:640f05bf57f0c028e2f3ecf4]  - Gentle reminder to get confirmation on [~accountid:712020:b33591a5-091a-4dca-bf26-45330ee93b71] comment. If cannot be fixed in due date of {{2026-04-16}} then only, deviation is required and expected to be in approved state. Hence, we can revise the remediation timelines for this issue. Thanks
[~accountid:712020:e059e4aa-65e1-4218-aabc-6970656f34ef] We are currently using some external help to get the kernel bump happening. This will enable us to address these issues.

[~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867] Ok, thanks for the update. Since, we are actively working on these issues to fix it. Please confirm if it  looks feasible to fix these issues due date of {{2026-04-16}} and can be included in next release 1.14. Therefore, deviation would not be required.
[~accountid:712020:e059e4aa-65e1-4218-aabc-6970656f34ef] It will not be in 1.14, the earliest we think we can get it in at a reasonable level of quality will be 1.16
[~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867] [~accountid:640f05bf57f0c028e2f3ecf4] Please provide deviation is on it since it cannot be fixed in 1.13. Thanks
[~accountid:712020:e059e4aa-65e1-4218-aabc-6970656f34ef] Deviation approved. Please resolve this in a timely manner.

 USB_NET_AX8817X: CVE-2022-2964

||*Attack scenario /* *Impact*|In general, this kind of vulnerabilities can be exploited by attacker having physical access., by inserting a specially crafted USB stick. * CVE-2024-26715 fixed in 6.1.85-1 (not clear about 5.x
Review the list of USB drivers, remove the ones not used by the solution.|

fields.description:
Original concern:

* Could we conduct a USB update system test to verify that no data is present in these folders? This could serve as a security test that is run periodically. This one I would consider quite important, as a mistake might be elementary to make, and it will easily go unnoticed.

Action:

* Remove all the USB Android Data Directory folder in the test beginning (depending on the test case, make sure the test result doesn’t get polluted by other failed)
* Check if the USB path has any content under /mnt/media_rw/${UUID}/Android/data/*/files/*/* during other tests, like conferencing or updating
** Q: When do you need to check?
** A: That was several behaviors behind the sense, there you have to
*** -1. Interval scan the folder every 5 mins as well-
*** -2. After passing the update check during OOBE-
*** -3. After passing onboarding (typing account)-
*** -4. After entering the settings page and changing one of the setup-
*** -5. After sharing by DP input or button, or opening the conferencing-
*** -6. After passing the XMS token registration-
*** 7. After updating the firmware → focus

Python command:

{code:python}import os

# List comprehension to enter
# all directories that have file to list

listfile = [os.path.join(root, f) for root, dirs, files, in os.walk('Android')
                   if not len(dirs) and len(files) for f in files]

print("Content Directories:")
print(listfile){code}

comments.body:
Normal way as done today:

{noformat}python3 vendor/barco/prebuilt/app/barco-optee/sign_encrypt.py --key privatekey.pem --uuid 99986025-2c8d-43ca-9598-b90e324e9d3b --in out_vendor/target/product/ms5578_duvel/unsigned/99986025-2c8d-43ca-9598-b90e324e9d3b.ta.unsigned --out out_vendor/target/product/ms5578_duvel/trustzone/barco_optee/99986025-2c8d-43ca-9598-b90e324e9d3b.ta{noformat}

However this script allows to perform the signing action in two phases:

* phase 1: calculate the digest (“digest” command)
* phase 2: integrate the signature (“stitch” command)

In calls this will become:

{noformat}python3 sign_encrypt.py digest --key publickey.pem --uuid 99986025-2c8d-43ca-9598-b90e324e9d3b --in 99986025-2c8d-43ca-9598-b90e324e9d3b.ta.unsigned
# this will create in the current directory a "<UUID>.dig" which contains the digest base64 encoded
# This digest has to be send to the signing server for signing (openssl command shown below)
# as an example this could be something like:
do_signing_on_signing_server.sh -i <UUID>.dig -o <UUID>.sig -t duvel_ta
# now do the stitching...
python3 sign_encrypt.py stitch --key publickey.pem --uuid 99986025-2c8d-43ca-9598-b90e324e9d3b --in 99986025-2c8d-43ca-9598-b90e324e9d3b.ta.unsigned --out 99986025-2c8d-43ca-9598-b90e324e9d3b.ta {noformat}

In between these two phases, a call to the signing server should be done which should create the signature.

Also the sign_encrypt script in its comments explain how to perform the signing:

{noformat}base64 -d <UUID>.dig | \\
openssl pkeyutl -sign -inkey <KEYFILE>.pem \\
                -pkeyopt digest:sha256 \\
                -pkeyopt rsa_padding_mode:pkcs1 | \\
base64 > <UUID>.sig{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Actual behavior

*CUSTOMER REPORT:*

I have some bad news.
We had an issue on the 22nd Dec with our Display wall. We had lost all the sources that are hosted on the Gateway at GGBN. They were only showing as black screens on the display wall.
The sources hosted on Kiosks remained up on the wall.
Tried a few different things:

* Un-sharing and resharing the sources to perspectives and creating new ones,
* Stopped and started the ProGateway service on the Gateway

Restarting the service brought the sources back the first time.
The same thing happened again the following night.
None of the above worked this time and gateway sources were still showing a black screen. In the end we rebooted the Gateway itself.
Once the Gateway was back up the sources hosted on it came back up.

I’ve had a look on the Gateway to find what caused it and found this in Event Viewer.
[cid:[image002.png@01DC7A47.A8EAF770|mailto:image002.png@01DC7A47.A8EAF770]]
04:26 would match up with the time when we first noticed there was a problem.
In the ProGatewaySvc.log I can see a gap in the logging between 04:25 and 08:19 when we rebooted the gateway. This looks like it normally logs several events every minute. Log attached.

[cid:[image003.png@01DC7A48.566CD800|mailto:image003.png@01DC7A48.566CD800]]
Again on the 23rd at 01:49 can see the same error message for ProGateway terminating unexpectedly.
[cid:[image004.png@01DC7A49.93B0A1A0|mailto:image004.png@01DC7A49.93B0A1A0]]

There is another gap in the log between 01:49 on the 23-12 and when the Progateway service was restarted.


*System has been stable since.*



Setup => NDN-220 with ODL 

    => Progateway hosted on NSD-220 

    

Version=> CMS 3.21 Build 0185

Progateway=> 3.11.0.0067 hostname => GGBNBARCOGTY1(NSD-220)

NDN version =>1.13  

 

Issue reported=>Progateway source were black on the screen .

Event time  => 22nd December 2025 @ 0426 hrs and on 23rd Dec around 0149 hrs . 

         Gateway rebooted on 08:19 on 22nd December 2025.

 

Logs attached => CMS , Progateway and NSD-220 windows logs. 



h3. Occurrence rate



h3. Workaround (If any)



{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Make sure to attach relevant artifacts (logs/videos/timestamp)
{panel}

fields.description:
We need to integrate the JSON configuration file for the Clickshare provider.

Currently the path where config files should reside is set to {{/system/product/etc/providers/}} (see file {{device/microsoft/rro_overlays/Frameworks/res_common/values/config.xml}}).



The results of the prior Spike point to these integration steps (similar steps to: [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-9606|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-9606|smart-link] )

# create a JSON file, roughly looking like this:
{noformat}{
	"name": "ClickShare",
	"layout_version": "1.1.0",
	"partner_bundle_version": "1.0.0",
	"id": 666,
	"binaries": [],
	"startupClass": "com.barco.clickshare.compositor/.CompositorService",
	"currentAdminClass": "com.microsoft.intune.aospagent/com.microsoft.intune.aospagent.deviceowner.broadcastcomponent.implementation.DeviceOwnerReceiver",
	"icon": "ClickShare/icon.png"{noformat}
Note that this might need a few tweaks. For details, refer to [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-9554|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-9554|smart-link] 
# the JSON file should reside in an arbitrary path; t can be added to the [MDEP contrib|https://github.com/barcoclickshare/wave4-platform-builder/tree/master/platforms/w4duvel/contrib/mdep] dir in w4pb, which will be copied automatically when running {{run.sh}}.
Original Teams path: {{packages/microsoft/prebuilt/apps/Teams/teamsProvisioningConfiguration.json}}
Barco path suggestion: {{device/microsoft/products/mdep_kiosk_collab_arm64/provision/clickshareProvisioningConfiguration.json}}
#  it should be copied to product inside a Makefile.
Suggestion: use {{device/microsoft/products/mdep_kiosk_collab_arm64/mdep.mk.provision}}, which will be included automatically in the build because all {{mdep.mk.*}} files are included; to create files here, we either use [helpers_mk.py|https://github.com/barcoclickshare/wave4-platform-builder/blob/master/wave4_libs/helpers/helpers_mk.py] or simply contrib (maybe discuss with *Primc(EXT), Blaz*)
Snippet to include it in the final image:
{noformat}# clickshareProvisioningConfiguration.json configuration file to be copied to /product/etc/providers/ 
PRODUCT_COPY_FILES += device/microsoft/products/mdep_kiosk_collab_arm64/provision/clickshareProvisioningConfiguration.json:$(TARGET_COPY_OUT_PRODUCT)/etc/providers/clickshareProvisioningConfiguration.json{noformat}
# Run a full build and check that the file exists and its contents are as expected:
{noformat}adb shell cat /product/etc/providers/clickshareProvisioningConfiguration.json{noformat}

fields.customfield_10080: We should keep 7+ days of data in the real time tables depending on table
fields.description:
Implement a mechanism to clean up the IBaseAssetUpdate, LocationUpdate, AccountUpdate tables.

E.g. “delete all records that are older than 3 days”

The data is joined between the ETL tables and the real time tables.
On the next day’s run the data in the real time tables is populated in the ETL table.
We should have a daily job that deletes records older than 7 days from the real time tables.

We want the job to be parametrized so that we have different limits for each table. We should make a control table for the real time tables to isolate it from the existing ETL flows.

* Make a control table in serve schema 
* Create pipeline to run daily
* Sync with JDM or Sulabh for scheduling via CA

comments.body:
Same problem occurred in system testing last night: [^logs2.zip] 

Before restarting NMS2 and the dongle, we see {{"source":"https://10.238.188.25/api/streaming/streams/mna-440-9730356262_hdmiIn1_rawstream0"}}: 

{noformat}2025-10-30 22:31:02,958Z INFO  [https-jsse-nio-10.238.188.7-8443-exec-3] c.b.n.n.d.r.DirectDeviceService: Sending video content to mna-640-2530406098_hdmiOut1: {"sinkName":"hdmiOut1","layout":{"name":"full_layout","originId":"nms-78d7ebc8-65b0-4888-85d1-f06019c1cea8","slots":[{"z-order":1,"id":"one","x":0.0,"y":0.0,"width":1.0,"height":1.0,"mirrorX":false,"mirrorY":false,"gravity":"CM","source":"https://10.238.188.25/api/streaming/streams/mna-440-9730356262_hdmiIn1_rawstream0","vnc":null,"scaleMode":"autoFit","vncfilter":null,"vnc-multihead":null,"crop-x":0.5,"crop-y":0.5,"crop-width":1.0,"crop-height":1.0}]},"overlay":{"uri":"https://10.238.188.7:8443/overlay.html?sinkId=mna-640-2530406098_hdmiOut1&pid=3305"}}{noformat}

Then after the restart of both NMS2 and the dongle, we see {{"source":null}}:

{noformat}2025-10-30 22:31:30,288Z INFO  [main] c.b.n.n.c.CoreMainKt: Starting CoreMainKt v2.0.0 using Java 17.0.13 with PID 3167925 (/opt/barco/nms/app/nms.jar started by nms in /opt/barco/nms)
...
2025-10-30 22:32:02,697Z INFO  [https-jsse-nio-10.238.188.7-8443-exec-3] c.b.n.n.d.r.DirectDeviceService: Sending video content to mna-640-2530406098_hdmiOut1: {"sinkName":"hdmiOut1","layout":{"name":"full_layout","originId":"nms-0655f1bf-c307-4d7c-9c22-77ad9ce93dbe","slots":[{"z-order":1,"id":"one","x":0.0,"y":0.0,"width":1.0,"height":1.0,"mirrorX":false,"mirrorY":false,"gravity":"CM","source":null,"vnc":null,"scaleMode":"autoFit","vncfilter":null,"vnc-multihead":null,"crop-x":0.5,"crop-y":0.5,"crop-width":1.0,"crop-height":1.0}]},"overlay":{"uri":"https://10.238.188.7:8443/overlay.html?sinkId=mna-640-2530406098_hdmiOut1&pid=3305"}}{noformat}

And another occurrence, this time in NexxisOR2.0 system testing: [^logs3.zip] and with an MNC-480 decoder:

{noformat}2025-11-03 20:13:03,290Z INFO  [https-jsse-nio-10.238.208.2-8443-exec-10] c.b.n.n.r.e.SendContentOnVideoContentCallRequested: Sending video content to mnc-480-1855230012_hdmiOut1 because VideoContentCallRequested
2025-11-03 20:13:03,293Z INFO  [https-jsse-nio-10.238.208.2-8443-exec-10] c.b.n.n.d.r.DirectDeviceService: Sending video content to mnc-480-1855230012_hdmiOut1: {"sinkName":"hdmiOut1","layout":{"name":"full_layout","originId":"nms-e0227b7c-d732-4177-8080-d285a4b2364c","slots":[{"z-order":1,"id":"one","x":0.0,"y":0.0,"width":1.0,"height":1.0,"mirrorX":false,"mirrorY":false,"gravity":"CM","source":"https://10.238.208.29/api/streaming/streams/mna-440-2530498223_hdmiIn1_rawstream0","vnc":null,"scaleMode":"autoFit","vncfilter":null,"vnc-multihead":null,"crop-x":0.5,"crop-y":0.5,"crop-width":1.0,"crop-height":1.0}]},"overlay":{"uri":"https://10.238.208.2:8443/overlay.html?sinkId=mnc-480-1855230012_hdmiOut1&pid=3308"}}
2025-11-03 20:13:03,311Z INFO  [https-jsse-nio-10.238.208.2-8443-exec-10] c.b.n.n.o.HttpClientLogger: POST https://10.238.208.40/v3/dolphin/outputInterface/hdmiOut1/content 200 17ms
...
2025-11-03 20:13:30,919Z INFO  [main] c.b.n.n.c.CoreMainKt: Starting CoreMainKt v2.0.0 using Java 17.0.13 with PID 3278324 (/opt/barco/nms/app/nms.jar started by nms in /opt/barco/nms)
2025-11-03 20:13:30,920Z INFO  [main] c.b.n.n.c.CoreMainKt: The following 2 profiles are active: "production", "user"
...
2025-11-03 20:14:02,597Z INFO  [https-jsse-nio-10.238.208.2-8443-exec-7] c.b.n.n.r.e.CreateVideoRoutingOnDeviceDiscovered: Sending video content to mnc-480-1855230012_hdmiOut1 because its boot session id is changed.
...
2025-11-03 20:14:02,674Z INFO  [https-jsse-nio-10.238.208.2-8443-exec-7] c.b.n.n.d.r.DirectDeviceService: Sending video content to mnc-480-1855230012_hdmiOut1: {"sinkName":"hdmiOut1","layout":{"name":"full_layout","originId":"nms-9477b3ac-8364-499c-aa7a-998a1ac5ffd4","slots":[{"z-order":1,"id":"one","x":0.0,"y":0.0,"width":1.0,"height":1.0,"mirrorX":false,"mirrorY":false,"gravity":"CM","source":"https://10.238.208.35/api/streaming/streams/mna-440-2530406106_streambackInput1_rawstream0","vnc":null,"scaleMode":"autoFit","vncfilter":null,"vnc-multihead":null,"crop-x":0.5,"crop-y":0.5,"crop-width":1.0,"crop-height":1.0}]},"overlay":{"uri":"https://10.238.208.2:8443/overlay.html?sinkId=mnc-480-1855230012_hdmiOut1&pid=3308"}}{noformat}

So NMS2 is sending a different source to the MNC-480 after restarting NMS2 than before, despite there being no API call to NMS to change the routing!

[~accountid:63d78344fb75f8568f5e8c53] Can’t instantly figure out what’s going on here either. I would suggest maybe adding some logging in the BackupApplier which does not use the {{DatabaseRecoveryLogger}}, as I’m suspicious for some reason perhaps the logging is going wrong? But it’s possibly that logging wouldn’t work either. It does seem like dataloss due to corrupt database is most likely. Perhaps writing manually to a file as a stopgap in /var/log/barco/nms for sanity checking? We have a corrupt sample DB in the tests (corrupt.nexxis.mv.db) to check if this works 🙂

[~accountid:557058:158b983c-dfcb-4678-aa68-8e74e7c323a2] I seem to be unable to reproduce this on our setups but maybe to gather some more information when a next hit occurs:

- Is there any custom logging config on those setups? If so, could this be provided? Perhaps the DatabaseRecoveryLogger has to be added there somewhere/gets overridden?
- To investigate any device event (return to fiber like) shenanigans maybe add 

{noformat}nexxis:
  logging:
    level:
      com.barco.nexxis.nmsplus.device.event:
        TRACE{noformat}

to the application-user.yml so we see all incoming device events (this will flood the logs a tad bit more though)
- Would it be possible to query the videorouting of the sink before and after the reboot and perhaps if possible share the before and after of the database files as well 🙂 (to make sure it was stored there)?

[~accountid:63d784a2790148a18092c530] [~accountid:63d783b8614cb4ba53fdbb26] For our side, wondering if it is a good idea to store some field in our database to indicate that it was recovered from a backup (e.g. the name of the backup file used or smth) that we can check with db inspection tools (or if we want we could allow to query it even)

[~accountid:63d78344fb75f8568f5e8c53] Since this has occurred on at least 2 different setups (MNC-480 → 208 and the original was on the MUIP of 212, I would have to check the third log I added to know whether that was yet another setup), it seems unlikely that both of those would have had tinkering with their log settings.  The MUIP in setup 212 cannot be checked anymore, as it is DEAD.  For the 208 setup we get:

{noformat}[barco@localhost]/etc/barco/nms% cat application.yml
#################################################################
#                    DO NOT TOUCH THIS FILE                     #
# Configuration changes should be made in application-user.yml  #
#################################################################
nexxis:
  ip: 10.238.208.2
  device:
    multicast:
      cidr: 239.208.0.0/16
  rootDir: /opt/barco/nms
  configDir: /etc/barco/nms
  logging:
    folder: /var/log/barco/nms
  data:
    folder: /etc/barco/nms/database
  versions:
    path: /opt/barco/nms/app/static/versions.json%                                                                                                                                                                                           [barco@localhost]/etc/barco/nms% cat application-user.yml
nexxis:
  interor:
    enabled: true
    healthcheck:
      treshold-ms: 9000
    bandwidth:
      upload: 100000
      download: 100000
  device:
    multicast:
      cidr: 239.208.0.0/16

[barco@localhost]/etc/barco/nms% cat application-user.yml
nexxis:
  interor:
    enabled: true
    healthcheck:
      treshold-ms: 9000
    bandwidth:
      upload: 100000
      download: 100000
  device:
    multicast:
      cidr: 239.208.0.0/16{noformat}

So, I don’t see anything special being configured for the logging.

I have added the requested TRACE to the config of the 208 now, so if it happens again on that setup, you should get the extra info.

The request to make copies of the database is going a bit too far I feel and does the NMS logging not give a clear view on what routing should be applied?  The test explicitly routes a source to the sink and I think it even verifies that that source is actually displayed by the sink before restarting NMS.  So the BEFORE should be pretty clear: the source we routed.  The state after the restart of NMS is checked, not by getting the routing in NMS, but by verifying again what is actually coming out of the sink.  In most of the failures we could see that this was “nothing” and in the log of the sink we could see NMS posted an empty slot.  In one case however it posted a different source (I think you indicated it was a source that previously had been routed to that sink).

Again such a case seen while testing power cycling the MCC-300: [^2025-12-2-14_31.zip] 

After the power-cycle the MNA-440 SDI decoder is getting sent a slot without URL:

{quote}2025-12-02T13:19:43.170304+00:00 mna-440-1855380046 [user.info|http://user.info] seabert[2527]: DIAGNOSTICS..> EVENT {"data":{"body":{"layout":{"name":"full_layout","originId":"nms-05eba142-55b1-4541-911f-8fa38a6d0776","slots":[*{"crop-height":1.0,"crop-width":1.0,"crop-x":0.5,"crop-y":0.5,"gravity":"CM","height":1.0,"id":"one","mirrorX":false,"mir*
2025-12-02T13:19:43.171184+00:00 mna-440-1855380046 user.debug seabert[2527]: *rorY":false,"scaleMode":"autoFit","width":1.0,"x":0.0,"y":0.0,"z-order":1}*]},"overlay":{"uri":"[https://10.238.232.2:8443/overlay.html?sinkId=mna-440-1855380046_sdiOut1&pid=3324|https://10.238.232.2:8443/overlay.html?sinkId=mna-440-1855380046_sdiOut1&pid=3324]"},"sinkName":"sdiOut1"},"path":"outputInterface/sdiOut1/content"},"type":"apiv3
2025-12-02T13:19:43.171184+00:00 mna-440-1855380046 user.debug seabert[2527]: _post"}{quote}

The overlay is provided and loaded upon receiving this content API call.  That overlay code then says:

{quote}2025-12-02T13:19:53.872170+00:00 mna-440-1855380046 [user.info|http://user.info] browser[3557]: sdiOut1: [CONSOLE_API]: [src: injected_bundle.js:4] [open] Websocket connection established: wss://10.238.232.2:8443/overlayEvents?videoSinkId=mna-440-1855380046_sdiOut1
2025-12-02T13:19:53.882016+00:00 mna-440-1855380046 [user.info|http://user.info] browser[3557]: sdiOut1: [CONSOLE_API]: [src: injected_bundle.js:5] [message] Updating elements because of Connection Established event
2025-12-02T13:19:53.882415+00:00 mna-440-1855380046 [user.info|http://user.info] browser[3557]: sdiOut1: [CONSOLE_API]: [src: injected_bundle.js:2] [renderElements] Rendering 0 elements:{quote}

So it indicates there is no orange overlay displayed on sdiOut1.  This is also reflected in the NMS Demo GUI where no orange overlay is shown, but the actual PCIe source which was already routed to this sink before the power cycle:


!image-20251202-133850.png|width=688,alt="image-20251202-133850.png"!

Still seen:

{noformat}Line 44242: 2025-12-11 22:05:07,749Z INFO  [https-jsse-nio-10.238.188.7-8443-exec-15] c.b.n.n.r.e.SendContentOnVideoContentCallRequested: Sending video content to mna-240-2530054637_dpOut0 because VideoContentCallRequested

Before the restart of NMS and the dongle, NMS is sending the correct source and the decoder is also receiving that stream.  After the restart of both, NMS is sending {{null}} and applying an orange overlay on the sink.

[^now-with-overlay.zip]

[~accountid:557058:158b983c-dfcb-4678-aa68-8e74e7c323a2] This seems like a different case than the one reproduced with the MCC-300. On that one we saw that the source was not discovered yet (without the extra logging even). Would it be possible to reproduce this issue on the 188 (as seen here) but with the logging we had on the MCC-300 test?
[~accountid:63d78344fb75f8568f5e8c53] I’ll install the extra logging instructions in the yml file on all our setups, so that if it hits again, you will have that logging.

[~accountid:557058:158b983c-dfcb-4678-aa68-8e74e7c323a2] Looking at the logs, the device only gets discovered when the timeout for the missing sources is already triggered. Currently NMS doesn’t send content on source discovery (only on sink discovery and waits until a specified timeout until the sources are present, if not it sends an incomplete routing, as mentioned in the logs)

Personally I wouldn’t mind sending content on source discovery but this could lead to more flickering upon NMS boot up… (e.g. all sources being discovered in different timings, I think that is the main reason why we got this weird flow now)

[~accountid:70121:7adb6e20-19e6-4822-9d48-ac8ac55c2351] 
It seems the underlying problem here is that in these tests, for whatever reason, it takes a while for a source to be seen by NMS. 

In the NexxisPlus days I see Firat added logic that, the first time we see a sink, for the next 3 minutes, we send new content calls in case sources start becoming online that are routed to that sink. After that we stop doing that, presumably to prevent unusual flickering.

I made a quick PR to just double this timeout to 6 minutes, which gives us a bit more playroom. This of course is not a 100% solution, the only other solution I see is to always do this, but then, you may get flickering. Do we put time into this, or do we just increase the timeout for now?

[^2026-1-16-15_8.zip]

Reproduction, where it seems the missing source listener just doesn’t always do its job:


!image-20260116-142009.png|width=659,alt="image-20260116-142009.png"!

!image-20260116-142019.png|width=638,alt="image-20260116-142019.png"!

Further reproduction, now with extra check in the code that verifies before the restart that the routing is actually reported back by NMS *AND* that the decoder is also producing the expected output: [^server.zip]

comments.body: [~accountid:712020:a95f6402-65e9-4532-9c4c-72821fb12033] Could you please also mention the rational for not considering this a blocker? This will help us improve our judgment when applying the propose2block label.

[~accountid:640f05d7f1b529dfa98b448f] You judgment is correct, decision is considering other aspects (not a regression, 1.12 BO ….). Please continue to propose blocking when you judge needed.
Thanks

[~accountid:640f05d7f1b529dfa98b448f] , [~accountid:712020:a95f6402-65e9-4532-9c4c-72821fb12033] , 

Can I get some more info on this? What is the specific trigger?
Because the combination of occurrence rate and workaround is frightening.

[~accountid:63d7859cfb75f8568f5e8da4] Yes, this is regarding the edit flow of user federation.

If we make any changes or modifications to the user DN or group DN DC and save the configuration, we lose all LDAP users along with their roles and permissions. Instead of showing warning or error message, system shows “*Import users/ groups success with '0” value updates”* in green banner (same as success banner).

The workaround is to recreate or modify the connection and then reassign roles and permissions to all users. Additionally, this is not a regression; it has been this way since the system’s inception.

I would just like to reiterate that this behavior is the same as it is with the iframe. So in my opinion this is an improvement, not a bug as this is expected behavior. There are some possible workarounds but it is still not clear what exactly has to be done to prevent this from a UX point-of-view.

For sure, this has to be improved and the user has to be warned though because there is indeed a dangerous consequence to changing the usersDn potentially.

[~accountid:712020:c9962731-5e24-4562-98eb-879aee127993] I updated the ‘Proposed action’ section with links to the Figma documentation. 

I didn’t add a warning message for the situations where the user clicks ‘Sync all users’ or ‘Sync changes’. Since a sync can still be succesful but result in no changes and we can probably not differentiate that from the situation where the sync leads to 0 users because of a wrong ‘users DN’ for example. However based on my current understanding the 2 improvements mentioned above should already be sufficient for now, to warn the user about the potential removal of all users and groups. 

However I noticed in the video above that there currently is no different banner message when syncing or when doing the import from the create/edit flow. However there is an idea behind this differentiation as [documented in Figma|https://www.figma.com/design/u9HLB9v2wpNTuLYAt8LKJI/4.0-CTRLsystem---User-management?node-id=3474-7899&t=3fD5PtqfWyLBkwRX-4]. Since a sync can also impact the groups, we use a more generic wording and also mention changes to groups. Can this be looked into as well?

[~accountid:712020:c9962731-5e24-4562-98eb-879aee127993] : Updated the Fix version to 1.14.0 since not allowed to go for 1.13.0 release track (only master track).
cc: [~accountid:557058:3b704ca5-9dad-42b3-8e9f-91eaa8222485]

I’ve still observed two issues (version: 2026.01.30-2326) -

# The same modal window appears twice, first after clicking "Import User/Group" and second upon clicking "Next." Please find the reference video attached
!20260130-0401-00.0015148.mp4|width=1074,alt="20260130-0401-00.0015148.mp4"!
# Message in the modal window for group import is incorrect.
!image-20260130-040849.png|width=475,alt="image-20260130-040849.png"!

For now, I’m reducing the severity to S3 and keeping the same defect instead of opening a new one, Assigning back to [~accountid:637ca6b1f6c85b343c08583d] .

cc: [~accountid:712020:a95f6402-65e9-4532-9c4c-72821fb12033]

[~accountid:640f05d7f1b529dfa98b448f] Hey Chirag, so for point 1, it’s an expected behavior, if the fields from import user or import groups are dirty this dialog is meant to appear on both: the sync button and the next button.

For point 2: I’ll raise a different PR for this fix since this ticket is already merged.
[~accountid:712020:e97ae198-663c-4453-8552-ca5851293c75] [~accountid:63d785418978d7a435382f48] Could you please confirm if this is the expected behavior from a UX standpoint for point 1?

[~accountid:640f05d7f1b529dfa98b448f] [~accountid:712020:c9962731-5e24-4562-98eb-879aee127993] Regarding point 1: even if both fields are modified, the first modal to be triggered is sufficient to communicate the update. Since modals are very disruptive, we should avoid triggering multiple windows b2b in the same page. 

here you can find the example of the correct modal regarding point 2: [https://www.figma.com/design/u9HLB9v2wpNTuLYAt8LKJI/4.0-CTRLsystem---User-management?m=auto&node-id=10725-52907&t=6dI0z7XCFi7ejueM-1|https://www.figma.com/design/u9HLB9v2wpNTuLYAt8LKJI/4.0-CTRLsystem---User-management?m=auto&node-id=10725-52907&t=6dI0z7XCFi7ejueM-1|smart-link] 

cc: [~accountid:63d785418978d7a435382f48]

fields.customfield_10046:
Follow this action plan:

* If the user makes any changes to the user import or group import settings in the edit flow, a modal window is shown as a warning when the user clicks ‘Next’ or ‘Import’. See documentation in Figma: [https://www.figma.com/design/u9HLB9v2wpNTuLYAt8LKJI/4.0-CTRLsystem---User-management?node-id=10725-52907&t=3fD5PtqfWyLBkwRX-4|https://www.figma.com/design/u9HLB9v2wpNTuLYAt8LKJI/4.0-CTRLsystem---User-management?node-id=10725-52907&t=3fD5PtqfWyLBkwRX-4|smart-link] 
* Instead of showing a [success banner message|https://www.figma.com/design/u9HLB9v2wpNTuLYAt8LKJI/4.0-CTRLsystem---User-management?node-id=3467-5969&t=3fD5PtqfWyLBkwRX-4] when 0 users or groups are impacted by the import, we will show a warning banner rmessage indicating that no users or groups were found. See documentation in Figma: [https://www.figma.com/design/u9HLB9v2wpNTuLYAt8LKJI/4.0-CTRLsystem---User-management?node-id=10713-19602&t=3fD5PtqfWyLBkwRX-4|https://www.figma.com/design/u9HLB9v2wpNTuLYAt8LKJI/4.0-CTRLsystem---User-management?node-id=10713-19602&t=3fD5PtqfWyLBkwRX-4|smart-link]
fields.customfield_10047:
The 0 users/groups updated / imported successful message when importing users/groups was wrongly displayed instead of displaying a warning message.

On the other hand, when attempting to update user/group import settings on the LDAP edit flow, keycloak seemed to reset credentials of these. Thus, modals were required to validate these actions.

comments.body:
Implementation flow:

# Establish ADB connection
# Install test APK onto the GOD
# Launch APK
# Trigger the test by sending a broadcast intent
# Capture runtime logs during test execution
# Extract the relevant test results from the collected logs
# Parse the result data into a structured format
# Validate the parsed results against expected outcomes

Decompress the [^test.7z] file.

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
# Update the device IP and serial number in {{tentoconfig.py}} to match your own GOD device.
# Unlock the screen on GOD.
{panel}

Run the commands below to perform proprietary API testing.

{noformat}pytest -vs .\test_proprietary_api.py{noformat}

As shown in the results below, one test passed and two tests failed after the test run.

{noformat}=============================================== short test summary info ===============================================
FAILED test_proprietary_api.py::TestProprietaryApi::test_preserve_hdmi_on_standby - AssertionError: HDMI standby failed
FAILED test_proprietary_api.py::TestProprietaryApi::test_verify_hdmi_listener_received_events - AssertionError: HDMI register listener failed
============================================= 2 failed, 1 passed in 6.39s ============================================{noformat}


The test APK and Python code can also be found in my personal GitHub repository, as shown below.

Please let me know if you need access permission.

* app-debug.apk: [baker-lin_Barco/msi-proprietary-api-test-tool|https://github.com/baker-lin_Barco/msi-proprietary-api-test-tool]
* test_proprietary_api.py: [msi-proprietary-api-test-tool/test/test_proprietary_api.py at main · baker-lin_Barco/msi-proprietary-api-test-tool|https://github.com/baker-lin_Barco/msi-proprietary-api-test-tool/blob/main/test/test_proprietary_api.py]

customfield_10020.name: OCS-Apollo-26.Q1.S3

fields.description:
To support LCD Wall deletion CT, some interceptor and mocks have to be added : 

* crossbar server (because autobahn package is using internally ws and msw cannot intercept websocket communication if the socket is not created through the native WebSocket from node, a crossbar server mock has to be implemented). It can be duplicated from source-service to avoid spending too much time on this → mock-services/mock-wamp-server.ts). This mock must be located in the ms-crossbar-event-channel lib. It also means that ws package will have to be introduce as a dev-deps
* upgrade-service interceptor is needed



Additional points:

* console log should be replaced by the nest logger
* it would be nice to been able to skip warning about unhandled requests sent on the Port of the app. (these logs are useless)
* implement a simple test to delete a LCD Wall (other tests related to deletion must be integration tests)

comments.body: More than enough demonstrations have already been carried out with the RGB SST with the original dimming curve. Two of our R&D units, which came out of confidence in February 2025 including the beta 3.10 demo unit built before summer 2025, have now been on demo tour for almost a year. The original dim curves are also present in these R&D demo units. PM was therefore fully aware of the system’s behavior but are questioning it again post CDR! This is a different context than how [~accountid:61574fe1c7bea40069085407] present it. They are requesting a change as explained above.
[~accountid:712020:ed29a5cc-990c-4777-8069-8048439969a8] [~accountid:640f05d69d6383e32a3080ab] FYI. [~accountid:61574fe1c7bea40069085407] Should this change target platinum 2.12 or master?
The feature is working fine !
Hi, they ask this for master + *2.12*  ! We go for *+7°C*.

fields.description:
PM is not happy with the power reduction in high humidity in RGB.

ExCom will probably decide to go over 70°C array temperature.

With  the introduction of a +new parameter+, the start of the illumination reduction is shifted to a higher temperature level of the dmd back temperature.

Example : Target = 18°C, if Dew Point + 6°C > 18°C → 3% Ill reduction / 1°C up in temperature. DP = 20 → DP+6=26 (= new target) → Ill = (100 - 3 . (26 - 18)) = 76%

New parameter = *7* --> Target = 18°C, if Dew Point + 6°C > 18*+7*°C → 3% Ill reduction / 1°C up in temperature. DP = 20 → DP+6=26 (= new target) → Ill = (100 - 3 . (26 - 18*+7*)) = 97%

QDX RGB → parameter =7

new parameter: DelayPowerReductionDegs
Documentation at: [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/wiki/x/pAxjDQ|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/wiki/x/pAxjDQ|smart-link] paragraph: DELAY POWER REDUCTION (IN) DEGREES

fields.customfield_10080:
* The base image has 2 flavours: 
** runtime for production → only NodeJS runtime
** dev for development (build pipelines etc.) → also includes npm / npx / ...
* The docker images are pushed to the production artifactory docker repo → {{docker-enp.bin.cloud.barco.com}}
* The images are based on the {{baseos-minimal}} docker images
* We can easily bump the baseos version, also for different Debian version
* We can easily bump the NodeJS version so a patch can be used quickly
** The NodeJS version is downloaded as a binary
* We support creating images for the same NodeJS version on multiple baseos versions
fields.description: Currently the NodeJS based barco CTRL services use an EIS supplied docker image. These images are not updated very frequently, and it always takes a lot of time when an image for a new node / baseos  version is requested. This intorduces a risk for the CTRL project as we often want to bump the NodeJS quickly (e.g. for security patching). To mitigate this, we will maintain our own image instead.

comments.body: [~accountid:5cd9e5268ad0f60dca009762] Can you clarify whether the issue also affects 4.2.1?
This information comes from the BU and is displayed on the app’s “About” page. It doesn’t affect the app’s functionality, but users may feel confused when they see this.
note: data will be impacted

reproduced on 04.02.00.0027: baseunit writes connection.meetingRoomName on the button at pairing time, probably just taken over by the app.  So might just be normal behavior, if meeting room name is not set to the same as the ssid?

check on 04.02.01.0028: same.

The meeting room name might be something more related to installation actions through XMS?

[Vercouter, Johan: Hey Bob, we have investigated a bit, so it is not different on 0... | P-GUESTS-MX Squads > Fox-1 | Microsoft Teams|https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/19:5317756ec81041be83de44c5b7432a4b@thread.skype/1770211533996?tenantId=aeb84c91-6270-4446-ada5-d71ceba1d535&groupId=0ea9e928-f189-4fcf-9519-884a107a2842&parentMessageId=1770198296501&teamName=P-GUESTS-MX%20Squads&channelName=Fox-1&createdTime=1770211533996]

[~accountid:61eaca5298cd610070717e34] , the MSI has uploaded the log for analysis. Can you check it and let us know the findings?

cc, [~accountid:557058:87e6cd43-eeb5-478c-94f3-7a0c9f0c3e77]

Hi [~accountid:61eacb08e2261a0069576958] , I had looked in the logs (same as in the other ticket it seems).  I can’t find much information in there myself, only that maybe some other button remotely connected or so.  It could be interesting if some developer can have a look if that is meaningful, because the serial numbers do not match with the ones on the client, so maybe some mixup there.

On the other hand, current findings:

* meetingRoomName is a bit ‘obscure’ to the user now, it’s not shown on the settings app from what we found.
* but it does get transferred to the button at pairing time, so likely the app gets it from the button in that case.
* it looks like it follows the same ‘logic’ as the ssid : at first boot, the combination ‘ClickShare-<SN>' is copied to it, which unluckily is the default 0123456789ABCDEF in many cases.  out-of-factory behavior could be adapted by applying he same as for the ssid : if we write the serial number (done only in factory or hopefully exceptional rework), then the ssid gets overwritten, so it could also do the same for the meetingRoomName I assume.



* info from [~accountid:557058:87e6cd43-eeb5-478c-94f3-7a0c9f0c3e77] : “I would like to get a view of current behavior”.  On some unit, the app showed the MTR name, so it could be that at some point, the meetingRoomName gets overwritten by … xms?  mtr?  : That should be the subject of an investigation by developers. He looks at @Fox-1  😁  for that.



* side note : I also saw that the ip shown in the app is 127.0.0.9 on 04.02.00.0027 and on 04.02.01.0028, where on the latest masters it seems correct.
** [~accountid:61eacb08e2261a0069576958] , [~accountid:712020:f28ca960-2e6b-439f-87f7-f0589bedef7f] , would you know by heart if this is a known issue and got corrected? or is it not under control yet?

Hello [~accountid:61eaca5298cd610070717e34], the IP address issue has been fixed in the Duvel image 04.03.00.master-1343 or latest (with UPSP 0.8.11).

[https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-8729|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-8729|smart-link]

[~accountid:5cd9e5268ad0f60dca009762], per the MSI update, the SSID and meeting room name are the default values. Please evaluate potential solutions to avoid rework at the MSI factory, as we are approaching the Chinese Lunar New Year (starting on Feb 14th) and the factory has limited capacity to process it. 

In the meantime, I requested MSI to process 2 experiments to determine whether the SSID and meeting room name can be corrected for the potential options.  

#  Factory reset + button pairing on 10 units 
# SN update curl command + button sharing for 3 units.

To avoid the same issue in 4.2.1 production, I labeled it as the 4.2.1 blocker as well.

Let’s meet at your time at 11:30 AM for further discussion.

cc, [~accountid:557058:dabe0280-5099-464d-887c-3f712b48d75c] , [~accountid:557058:87e6cd43-eeb5-478c-94f3-7a0c9f0c3e77] , [~accountid:712020:c51acf87-d5ed-48c9-b5d8-f4f1380dccc0] , [~accountid:61eaca1038041c00687e441a]

Currently we can only reproduce the issue with the Meeting Room name

The 04.02.00.0027 uses Production API 1.34.12 which contains [https://github.com/barcoclickshare/production-api-apk/blob/1.34.12/app/src/main/java/com/barco/clickshare/productionapi/resources/SerialNumber.kt#L33|https://github.com/barcoclickshare/production-api-apk/blob/1.34.12/app/src/main/java/com/barco/clickshare/productionapi/resources/SerialNumber.kt#L33] 

This code explicitly sets the SSID when the serial number is being set, which was done for [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-8373|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-8373|smart-link]

[~accountid:712020:9b1096d6-bce4-4d20-9f44-169d98b8eba4] as part of this ticket we suggest adding a test to chapter 9 to ask MSI to go to the about of the app, and check that the Meeting Room Name matches the serial number. Checking the SSID is not easy to do, but since the code is so related in Network Manager, it seems fine to only include that one part.

Did some more tests. For the Meeting Room Name, the issue makes perfect sense, as Network Manager sets it before the serial number is set through Production API, and Production API never changes it.

But for the SSID the local logs are as expected:

{noformat}02-05 14:30:44.184  3396  3505 D SoftApEnabler: Construct default SSID: ClickShare-0123456789ABCDEF
02-05 14:30:47.616  4231  4231 D ProductionApiService: onStartCommand of Service: flags: 0, startId: 1{noformat}

So first Network Manager sets it based on the incorrect value. But when the Serial Number is then set through the Production API, that corrects the SSID.

For us this always works, but perhaps there is some circumstance that prevents Production API from updating the Configuration Manager value (or we still struggle with the 30s sync problem, so that the correct SSID has not actually been written to the flash; but that would also be odd as the Configuration Manager change was included in the 04.02.00.0027).

The proposed change of adapting Network Manager to check for the default 0123456789ABCDEF before trying to set SSID and Meeting Room Name does still seem like the best way forward. But we would like to understand why MSI has this issue, while we can’t reproduce.

Two additional ideas I had:

* Maybe MSI optimized by writing into the proinfo and then ensuring that the flashing with the MTK tool does not override this. But I see from the logs
{{[persist.barco.serial_number]: [1882002461]}}so it should still be the case that the real serial number is also in RPMB (meaning Production API was used to set it).
* Perhaps iot-agent is able to access XMS? No evidence of that in the logs, but those logs are from after an additional boot, so probably also from another location. Just to clear out if [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-8744|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0666-8744|smart-link]  could be related.
Asked Wouter and Rob if either of them can look in the records of XMS for serial number {{1882002461}}.

Confirmed by [~accountid:557058:dabe0280-5099-464d-887c-3f712b48d75c] that the serial number does not appear in the IoT dump of last Friday

Normally the units at MSI are not getting online, and that dump confirms it, so we can normally rule out XMS/iot-agent interfering with the SSID

[~accountid:61eacb08e2261a0069576958] requested MSI during the production of one if the ~800 units in the China factory, to deliver us the logs at the end of chapter 7 (but before the factory reset), and also at the start of chapter 8 (after the reboot)

Unfortunately they use a release build, so we will be missing the debug logs, but we can maybe still see some traces of what the SSID was in both cases.

[~accountid:61eaca5298cd610070717e34] and [~accountid:712020:9b1096d6-bce4-4d20-9f44-169d98b8eba4] were able to reproduce after wiping the pkcs11 data

{noformat}chmod +x /data/pkcs11-tool/pkcs11-tool
chmod o+rw /dev/tee0
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/data/pkcs11-tool/
cd /data/pkcs11-tool
su 2901
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type data --label serial-number --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type data --label firstboot --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type data --label country-code --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type data --label product --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type data --label platform --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type data --label article-number --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type data --label model --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type cert --label clickshare-root-certificate --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type cert --label clickshare-ic1-certificate --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type cert --label clickshare-ic2-certificate --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type cert --label clickshare-leaf-certificate --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type privkey --label clickshare-key --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type pubkey --label clickshare-key --login
CKTEEC_LOGIN_TYPE=group CKTEEC_LOGIN_GID=2901 ./pkcs11-tool --module /data/pkcs11-tool/libckteec.so --delete-object --type data --label mac-address --login{noformat}

After then flashing the unit, and following the production flow we see the ‘root cause’:

{noformat}02-11 07:29:04.326 10091  3302  3383 D ConfigurationProvider: update(clickshare, BaseUnit.WiFi.AccessPoint.1.SSID, ClickShare-1882000179) from pid: 4430
02-11 07:29:09.105 10091  3302  3994 D ConfigurationProvider: query(clickshare, BaseUnit.WiFi.AccessPoint.1.SSID) from pid: 5012
02-11 07:29:09.111 10082  5012  5032 D SoftApConfigListener: uri: CLICKSHARE_URI, id:BaseUnit.WiFi.AccessPoint.1.SSID, value: null
02-11 07:29:09.111 10082  5012  5032 E SoftApConfigListener: Value is null or empty for ID: BaseUnit.WiFi.AccessPoint.1.SSID{noformat}

So Production API set the SSID correctly, but when Network Manager does the query for the new value, it somehow receives an empty string (or null) instead, and it overrides the value.

comments.body: Since the FW version 04.02.00.0024 is no longer available on the FTP server, I will use 04.02.00.0026 to reproduce this issue.

Current status:

Base Unit version: 04.02.00.0026 Release
Vedett fw version: 3.1.0
One 1080p ViewSonic monitor TD1655, monitor is connected to the BU via HDMI 2 port
One 4K Samsung monitor LS27A800U is connected to the BU via HDMI 1 port
Vedett PVT is connected to BU.

-> The issue is not isolated to a specific monitor; I reproduced it using two different monitors on both HDMI port 1 and HDMI port 2.

*Expected Result:* The UI should return to the "*Join a Teams meeting with an ID*" screen after 5 seconds, displaying the message: "{color:#ff5630}*Unable to find a meeting matching those details.*{color}"

!image-20260205-095929.png|width=500,alt="image-20260205-095929.png"!


And I also tested the behavior with different numbers of monitors, the results are detailed below:

|| ||*Vedett + one Screen(HDMI 1)* + *one Screen(HDMI 2*||*Vedett + one Screen(HDMI 1)*||*one Screen(HDMI 1) + one Screen(HDMI 2)*||*one Screen (HDMI 1)*||
|result|{color:#bf2600}*NOK*{color}|{color:#bf2600}*NOK*{color}|{color:#006644}*OK*{color}|{color:#006644}*OK*{color}|
|photo|!Image (35).jpg|width=154,alt="Image (35).jpg"!|!Image (34).jpg|width=159,alt="Image (34).jpg"!|!Image (36).jpg|width=154,alt="Image (36).jpg"!
!MicrosoftTeams-video.mp4|width=320,alt="MicrosoftTeams-video.mp4"!|!Image (37).jpg|width=154,alt="Image (37).jpg"!|

The issue is still 100% reproducible on the latest firmware version (*04.03.00.master-1443*). According to the Logcat output, there is only a one-line difference between the unexpected result and the expected result logs.

-> We suspect this is an *MTR (Microsoft Teams Rooms)* bug. We will open an *ADO* with Microsoft while continuing our internal analysis of the logs.

The {color:#bf2600}*unexpected* {color}result:

{noformat}02-09 16:44:45.326 D/MTRActionReceiver( 2963): onReceive: Intent { act=com.microsoft.skype.teams.ipphone.APP_INCALL_STATE flg=0x10 (has extras) }
02-09 16:44:45.326 D/MTRActionReceiver( 2963): MTR in call state: 1
02-09 16:44:45.326 D/ContentProvider( 2963): Set MTR incall state to: true
02-09 16:44:45.329 I/CSService|com.barco.clickshare.configurationmanager( 2957): [ConfigurationProvider] update(clickshare, BaseUnit.MTR.InCallState, true) from pid: 2963
02-09 16:44:45.331 D/AudioStreamTrack(10164): open(), request notificationFrames = -8, frameCount = 0
02-09 16:44:45.337 D/AudioStreamTrack(10164): open() flags changed from 0x00000104 to 0x00000000
02-09 16:44:45.337 D/AudioStreamTrack(10164): open() perfMode changed from 12 to 10
02-09 16:44:48.564 D/MTRActionReceiver( 2963): onReceive: Intent { act=com.microsoft.skype.teams.ipphone.APP_INCALL_STATE flg=0x10 (has extras) }
02-09 16:44:48.564 D/MTRActionReceiver( 2963): MTR in call state: 0
02-09 16:44:48.564 D/ContentProvider( 2963): Set MTR incall state to: false
02-09 16:44:48.581 I/CSService|com.barco.clickshare.configurationmanager( 2957): [ConfigurationProvider] update(clickshare, BaseUnit.MTR.InCallState, false) from pid: 2963
02-09 16:44:48.611 I/MtraDisplayUtils(10164): ProcessId: 10164, Thread: DefaultDispatcher-worker-32, Touchscreen enabled: false, Console connected: true{noformat}

The {color:#006644}*expected* {color}result:

{noformat}02-09 16:40:41.812 D/MTRActionReceiver( 2963): onReceive: Intent { act=com.microsoft.skype.teams.ipphone.APP_INCALL_STATE flg=0x10 (has extras) }
02-09 16:40:41.812 D/MTRActionReceiver( 2963): MTR in call state: 1
02-09 16:40:41.812 D/ContentProvider( 2963): Set MTR incall state to: true
02-09 16:40:41.816 I/CSService|com.barco.clickshare.configurationmanager( 2957): [ConfigurationProvider] update(clickshare, BaseUnit.MTR.InCallState, true) from pid: 2963
02-09 16:40:41.885 D/AudioStreamTrack( 8592): open(), request notificationFrames = -8, frameCount = 0
02-09 16:40:41.897 D/AudioStreamTrack( 8592): open() flags changed from 0x00000104 to 0x00000000
02-09 16:40:41.897 D/AudioStreamTrack( 8592): open() perfMode changed from 12 to 10
02-09 16:40:44.876 D/MTRActionReceiver( 2963): onReceive: Intent { act=com.microsoft.skype.teams.ipphone.APP_INCALL_STATE flg=0x10 (has extras) }
02-09 16:40:44.878 D/MTRActionReceiver( 2963): MTR in call state: 0
02-09 16:40:44.878 D/ContentProvider( 2963): Set MTR incall state to: false
02-09 16:40:44.890 I/CSService|com.barco.clickshare.configurationmanager( 2957): [ConfigurationProvider] update(clickshare, BaseUnit.MTR.InCallState, false) from pid: 2963{noformat}

* Prerequisites:
-- Base Unit version: 04.02.00.0024 Release

* Expected results:

# I believe that the system, including Vedett should return to the MTR wallpaper if the meeting details are not correct. 

* Occurrence rate:
-- 3/3 attempts
* Fixed by:

       --

fields.description:
For SISO quality report we are joining data from silver but the join is as follows: 
  FROM  siso.silver s
     LEFT JOIN bsc.SisoSor g ON s.id = g.bronze_row_id

But for some files the bronze row id is null and that is changed to 0 in gold. 
This is likely due to the files not having been re processed after the ID fix. 

Also 

{code:sql}total_claim_value,
total_spid_claim_value,
total_drid_claim_value,
amer_reseller_cost{code}

Have NaN values in Sivler that cause issues reading the table and need to also be fixed.

{quote}Hi MTK team,

Since we would like to switch to the latest version v1.2548, on both Windows and Linux, for GOD.
We found that there is a Windows version for v1.2548 (which is V6, so v6.2548).
However, we don't see a SP flash tool for Linux.
Could you please help with this?

Thank you
Chanel{quote}

[https://eservice.mediatek.com/eservice-portal/issue_manager/update/143236273|https://eservice.mediatek.com/eservice-portal/issue_manager/update/143236273]

{quote}Hi MTK team,

I have tried to flash Duvel using the latest SP flash tool, v.5.2548.00.
However, it says that the DA does not match.
​It seems that the SP flash tool DLL’s validation of instructions sent to the MTK SoC via DA may be causing an incorrect hash issue.

Noted that the same DA works on v.5.2444.00, but not on v.5.2548.00 (was using the factory material from master-1378).

Thanks
Chanel{quote}

fields.description:
When we try to flash Duvel with v5.2548 (which is the latest version), it says that the DA does not match.

!image-20260210-130552.png|width=319,alt="image-20260210-130552.png"!

Looks like the DA binary needs to be updated to be used on v5.2548.00.

The same DA works on v.5.2444.00, but not on v.5.2548.00 (was using the factory material from master-1378)



adding more info:

the SP flash tool version MTK created are v1.2444 (2025 ver) and v1.2548 (2026 ver)

and in those versions, you can find V5 and V6

for example, in the v1.2444 version, you can find v5.2444 (for duvel) and v6.2444 (for GOD)

customfield_10020.name: Team404 - Sprint 218

fields.description:
The provider ID config is set in file {{device/microsoft/rro_overlays/Frameworks/res_common/values/config.xml}}:

{noformat}<!-- default selected service provider ID -->
<!-- The ID is set in the provisioning manifest for each bundle-->
<!-- No provider selected: 0 -->
<!-- Microsoft Teams ID: 777 -->
<!-- Sample Provider ID: 999 -->
<!-- MDEP platform requires a default ID set in order to complete the automatic provisioning flow -->
<integer name="config_defaultProviderId">0</integer>{noformat}


As the path suggest, this is a Runtime Resource Overlay (RRO). Barco should change this config using the same mechanism to align with MDEP.

comments.body:
[~accountid:63d78502010d3563796ff7db] 
Provided link doesn’t work and can you ask for a video?

Need some more details on the setup, how is the PC connected to the d440?
Native HDMI or DP->HDMI?

[~accountid:61fb7f7eacd4cb0069d0af29] You’re right, the first link ended up with the webpage having a typo - however sharepoint achieved to provide a broken link…

I’ll request a video and further information on the connection between the PC and D440.

They do agree that this might be related to network, given that 4:2:2 is of course increasing the network bandwidth usage.

[~accountid:63d78502010d3563796ff7db]we also faced the exact same issue when sharing a common web source — NGS‑D440 streams started flickering. Later, we found that the LAN cable was limited to 100 Mbps. After replacing the cable with a Gigabit‑supported one, the issue was resolved.

Tagging [~accountid:557058:3d792d4d-0919-4e12-bf70-fa39fe793d4f] , who recently faced the same issue

[~accountid:63d782a61b13d42998e06144] 
This could indeed be an issue as we support YUV 4:2:2 streaming in CTRL 1.12, which requires more bandwidth, but we first need to have a working link to the logs to see it’s that’s a possible culprit.
CTRL 1.12 should have correct network diagnostics: [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-26186|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-26186|smart-link] .

Mind that we have had issues before and that idea was to put the source in warning state in ctrl, but I don’t know if this has been implemented as such:
[https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-15918?focusedCommentId=1312862|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-15918?focusedCommentId=1312862|smart-link]

[~accountid:63d7859cfb75f8568f5e8da4] [~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867] 
Added link to possible related ticket about network speed and how to handle < 1 Gbps in ctrlsystem: [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-15918|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-15918|smart-link] 
Seems like this ticket is at a standstill for a long time, but should be taken up to have a holistic ctrl way of handling possible too low network bandwidth.

[~accountid:61fb7f7eacd4cb0069d0af29] [~accountid:63d782a61b13d42998e06144] 


I’ve requested details on which devices we should be looking it, given there are way too many devices in that log archive.
Below is the response wrt to the video:

_Video is appx 10min before log, but the tearing appers all the time so it should not matter._

_NGS and SAN that video shows, but tearing appers on all different SAN and NGS._

_NGS : Barco NGS‑D440DEC-081 Dalen: 2. ETG: Desk SNR: F2B2531666945 MAC:00:04:A5:F6:1D:6E_

_SAN: BarcoSAN‑050DEC-024 Dalen: 2. ETG: Skjermvegg Skagerak Snr:2531667048 Mac:0004A5F72818 Mac:0004A5F72819_

[PQM] Customer is using a 1Gbps connection, so that should not be the cause. Kevin to add more info on this.
Ryan will link to another similar issue, also using 1Gbps.

Partner confirmed, they use gigabit. Customer, who reproduced the issue is also using gigabit.

_Everything is connected with 1Gbit/s network, to one Ubiquiti switch. That one is from our demokit, however customer (Kyndryl,_ [_CZ243201_|https://serviceportal.barco.com/s/projects/a5A8Y000000eFXzUAM/cz243201]_) has the same behavior. Again, connected to one Cisco switch vi gigabit network._

[~accountid:63d78502010d3563796ff7db] 
_SAN: BarcoSAN‑050DEC-024 Dalen: 2. ETG: Skjermvegg Skagerak Snr:2531667048 Mac:0004A5F72818 Mac:0004A5F72819:_
ngs-d440-2531666947 => san-050-2531667048

The input timing is actually *2026-01-22T16:35:16.255385+01:00 ngs-d440-2531666947 user.debug seabert[780]: new timing: 3840x2160 60Hz CEA (VIC = 97)*, instead of configured preferred timing *2560x1440p59.951.*

We see a lot of latency outliers that last longer than a video frame period in the h.265 low latency stream, which are indicative of the known scheduler/vcu issues ([[OCS0001-16848] [MEDIA][NGS-D440]: intermittent h265 streaming issues - Jira|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-16848])

2026-01-22T16:40:33.980275+01:00 ngs-d440-2531666947 [user.info|http://user.info] zynq_omx_rtp_enc[26703]: g_log: zynq_omx_rtp_enc: latency outlier: sample 12.579355 ms, avg 4.458818 ms, std deviation 0.391167 ms, outliers 25

[~accountid:61fb7f7eacd4cb0069d0af29] 
Is customer aware that the video timing input to the ngs-d440 is actually 3840x2160@60 iso 2560x1440@60?
Are they using DP->HDMI adapters?
Are they forcing UHD timing in windows or video card driver app?
Latency outliers are also negatively impacted by having the source in focus in CTRLSystem, as that will greatly increase the rate of thumbnails requests towards the encoder, which negatively affect the scheduler.
If customer would disable interaction, which would configure the encoder to stream in normal latency, the issue should go away, can you have them test that and report back?

The reason why customer is now seeing this is probably due to YUV 4:2:2 streaming, cf. [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-30004?focusedCommentId=1555560|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-30004?focusedCommentId=1555560|smart-link] 
2026-01-22T16:34:25.605888+01:00 ngs-d440-2531666947 user.warning seabert[780]: VIDEO..> NGSD440RtpH26xVideoStream::startPipeline HDMIIn1_h26xstream0: Starting with params: /usr/bin/omxrtpenc --mode h265ll --index 0 --destination 239.7.7.40 --port 5004 --interface bond0 --width 3840 --height 2160 --ttl 5 --framerate 60 --ssrc 70632
2026-01-22T16:34:25.606317+01:00 ngs-d440-2531666947 user.debug seabert[780]: 8346 --sampling *yuv422* -c
[~accountid:61fb7f7eacd4cb0069d0af29] , I have a 4K@60Hz encoder source in my validation setup, and I don’t see any challenge while open CTRLsystem/ CTRLwall requesting thumbnails

[~accountid:63d782a61b13d42998e06144] 
Is it streaming in YUV 4:2:2? So is encryption enabled and support legacy ops devices disabled in CTRLSystem?

Also, the issue is intermittent, so could be you have to watch for a long time to see it.

We see a lot of latency outliers that last longer than a video frame period in the h.265 low latency stream, which are indicative of the known scheduler/vcu issues ([+[OCS0001-16848] [MEDIA][NGS-D440]: intermittent h265 streaming issues - Jira+|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-16848]).
The reason why customer is now seeing this is probably due to YUV 4:2:2 streaming, cf. [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-30004?focusedCommentId=1555560|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-30004?focusedCommentId=1555560|smart-link].

comments.body:
[~accountid:640f05d69d6383e32a3080ab] This is a Qt bug. When the preview is disabled ({{image.source.preview.enable}}), the OSD/LCD Preview dashboard page should not exist. If it does not exist, it won’t be accessible from PP either.

This is a perfect candidate to solve together with [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/PRJ0666-20354|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/PRJ0666-20354|smart-link]

[~accountid:5de38108de32fb0d03a3913e] Just checked and indeed the source preview was possible via remote LCD. But [~accountid:557058:14c56e9b-61c0-4de0-a154-6ec688444012] and myself included seem to recall that some changes were made in the past to prevent someone from seeing the source preview remotely.

[~accountid:640f05d69d6383e32a3080ab] [~accountid:557058:14c56e9b-61c0-4de0-a154-6ec688444012] 
From the Qt source code it seems if a projector supports the {{Preview}} feature, there is an LCD Dashboard page for it. Regardless if the feature is enabled or disabled.

* If the {{Preview}} feature is enabled, the preview is shown on the {{Preview}} page.
* If the {{Preview}} feataure is disabled, there should still be a {{Preview}} page, but it should be empty.

It seems the logic to show the empty page is missing in Qt, so this is the bug.

Viewing the LCD *directly* or through *Pulse Prospector* makes no difference.

fields.customfield_10041: connect a source to any input and make sure that source preview is disabled. Go into pulse propector to tab tools and then select “remote & keypad”. Press on the remote a few times to the right until you are at the source preview. Now you see the image/video of the connected source.

comments.body: [~accountid:712020:00497842-c375-4b42-a5c4-aaade9cb679f] Please help to check this issue related to OOBE setting, thank you!
Fix implementaion is in progress.

Radio buttons in High Contrast Mode and Text Size preferences weren't scaling when font size changed - they remained at their original size while the title scaled correctly. Added refreshRadioButtonText() method that copies the title's text size to radio buttons during view binding, ensuring consistent font scaling across all elements.

Implementation fix has been done via the following Pull Request:
[fix: [CS0666-9315] Font size consistency fix for Accessibility Settings by andrei-lupan-ext_Barco · Pull Request #544 · barcoclickshare/mdep-settings-apk|https://github.com/barcoclickshare/mdep-settings-apk/pull/544]

I have also attached some screenshots regarding behaviour before and after the fix:

!OOBE_Before_Fix.png|width=625,alt="OOBE_Before_Fix.png"!

*Settings before fix:*

!Settings_Before_Fix.png|width=594,alt="Settings_Before_Fix.png"!

!Settings_After_Fix.png|width=612,alt="Settings_After_Fix.png"!

*OOBE after fix:*

fields.description:
Automation | Insights backend automation E2E & for Intermediate tables.

Flow for Automation:

# Set the timestamp for pipeline run
# prepare dataset(avro file with changed timestamp)
# Trigger Insights E2E pipeline & wait for its completion
# Validate result in SQL
# Again set timestamp & dataset if there is any cross pipeline scenario
# Trigger Insights E2E pipeline
# Validate result
These steps we are following initially and will try one manual run. If we succeed in this then will start for Automation.

Work done till now as part of [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0062-13151|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CS0062-13151|smart-link]  :

# Script that getting data for any environment(dev/master/prd) from azure → Update that data avro files → Upload back to automation folder in azure 
# Updating checkpoints & triggering pipeline manually
# Comparing this data in SQL with the source data
