comments.body:
h2. Commit 1

PRJ0666-20802: PP - Fix memory leaks and FormControl error in Console Component

# The console input field was incorrectly using both {{formControlName="jsonrpc"}} and {{[formControl]="jsonRpcFormControl"}} simultaneously: {{<input formControlName="jsonrpc" [formControl]="jsonRpcFormControl" />}}. Angular's forms system doesn't allow mixing these two directives:

* {{formControlName}} requires a parent {{[formGroup]}} directive and looks up the control by string name.
* {{[formControl]}} is for standalone form controls with direct instance binding.
This caused Angular to throw runtime errors every time the component was initialized.
Solved by removing invalid {{formControlName="jsonrpc"}} attribute, keeping only {{[formControl]="jsonRpcFormControl"}}.

# Unmanaged subscriptions (memory leaks): two subscriptions were created without proper cleanup:

* {{this.consoleService.logEventEmitter.subscribe(l => {this.updateLog()})}}
* {{this.dialogService.showConfirm(...).subscribe(result => {if (result === true) {this.consoleService.clear()}})}}
Each time the Console component was created (e.g., during navigation or user switching), new subscriptions were registered but never cleaned up when the component was destroyed.

The codebase uses a {{SubscriptionCleaner}} base class (located in {{SubscriptionCleaner.ts}}) to handle subscription lifecycle management:

* Components/services extend {{SubscriptionCleaner}}
* Use {{this.subscribe(observable, callback)}} instead of {{observable.subscribe(callback)}}
* The helper method automatically applies {{takeUntilDestroyed()}} operator
* Angular's {{DestroyRef}} detects component/service destruction
* All subscriptions are automatically unsubscribed on cleanup
* No need for manual {{ngOnDestroy()}} or subscription tracking
This pattern is already used extensively throughout the codebase (20+ components including MainComponent, BlendAndMaskService, ShutterControlButtonComponent, etc.).

All subscriptions on the Console component now automatically clean up when the component is destroyed, preventing memory leaks.

comments.body:
In a wireshark trace taken from the MICE laptop that will not reconnect (most of the time), there is no sign of a connection attempt on the wired connection. However, when the Miracast Direct connection is terminated, there are a lot of MDNS packets sent by the base unit that appear to be flushing the cache   For example in this trace, the MICE call ended at 12:59:25

!image-20260123-130642.png|width=1145,alt="image-20260123-130642.png"!



No reconnect MICE sessions could start again until the Windows device received the following MDNS packets when the Miracast direct connection was terminated



!image-20260123-130835.png|width=1130,alt="image-20260123-130835.png"!



After that - the MICE calls can connect OK. 



I added a couple of network traces from the test setup

Occurrence rate is 100%. Also can be reproduced on other platforms.

In older versions like 02.24.0005, multiple Miracast would fail, so not reproducing the problem.

In my point of view, the device discovery message which looks like “reconnect attempt” at {{2026-01-23T11:06:28}} was not actually related to Miracast MICE, because it came from P2P network, not {{eth0}}. So it’s likely that the C-10 did not receive a reconnect attempt from the PC.

I’ll raise a ticket and confirm with Squirrels team about this.
PQM - Reproduced and investigation ongoing with Squirrel team

[~accountid:712020:37d25faf-3cb4-46b7-9174-f2531fca43ad] Andy confirms the same is visible on his end that the PC does not attempt to reconnect until the connection gets flushed by a new attempt from Base Unit side

Looked deep into the logs. Captured only 2 times of connecting attempt from Miracast MS-MICE. One at {{11:01:02.843}}, another at {{11:08:36.032}}. This means the C-10 did not receive reconnecting attempt during Miracast P2P.

[[CSAP-570] Miracast | MICE connection fails to re-connect if if there is an active Miracast Direct connection - Jira|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/CSAP-570] Ticket has been raised to SQ team to find out if it is a limitation or bug.
PQM - Waiting on Feedback from SQ team

Below is SQ team’s conclusion.

“Brian Meek commented: This is likely a limitation of the relationship between Miracast P2P and Miracast MICE.
Due to the nature of P2P, while there is an active Miracast P2P connection, RFL stops broadcasting the Miracast P2P discovery beacon. If we did, other Miracast P2P devices would still be able to discover the receiver, but be unable to connect since RFL has an active Miracast P2P connection.
Miracast MICE “piggy-backs” off of the mechanisms of Miracast P2P. The MICE discovery and connection process starts exactly the same as Miracast P2P. For discovery, there is some additional data within the standard Miracast P2P beacon - letting MICE enabled devices know that the P2P receiver is capable of MICE.

So if we are not broadcasting Miracast P2P discovery, consequently we are also not broadcasting Miracast MICE discovery.“

fields.description:
Problem seen during lab tests using Clickshare C-10 version 2.25. 

Clickshare is LAN connected with wired IP connection of 172.17.1.105

Laptop with wired connection to the same network 172.17.1.15 - DESKTOP-3RBGVFB - Windows 10

Laptop with wifi enabled but not connect to a network - DESKTOP-S2B6EFQ - Windows 10



Problem - If the MICE connection is made and then the direct connection is added, both connect and display OK. If then the MICE connection is dropped, the Windows K menu loses the device until it’s refreshed, by exiting Windows K and then entering it again.

If the MICE connection is attempt to connect again, the connection fails. Waiting a few minutes does not help, the connection still fails. 

If the Miracast Direct connection is disconnected, then the MICE connection will start to work/connect OK



In the reflector logs I didn’t see the reconnect attempts, but in the message.log there appears to be an indication of a connect request

2026-01-23T11:06:28.233368+00:00 C10 kernel: [schedu][0x18d5120d][11:06:28.233270] wlan: [859:I:P2P] p2p_rx_update_connection_status: Provision discovery request <--- OTA from e8:2a:ea:30:f0:a8
2026-01-23T11:06:28.233543+00:00 C10 wpa_supplicant[3265]: P2P-PROV-DISC-PBC-REQ e8:2a:ea:30:f0:a8 p2p_dev_addr=e8:2a:ea:30:f0:a8 pri_dev_type=1-0050F200-0 name='DESKTOP-3RBGVFB' config_methods=0x11e8 dev_capab=0x24 group_capab=0x2 group=p2p0





The issue happens in my testing most of the time. Connecting the Miracast direct connection first still cause the MICE connection to fail on it’s second attempt

fields.description:
The Matrox dongle is sending muliple SRDs and the media_receiver from the Rivermax SDK we integrated does not support muliple SRDs in GPUDirect mode.

This is the response of one of the Rivermax developers ( Thomas True<[TTrue@nvidia.com|mailto:TTrue@nvidia.com]> on 8/22/2024 ):

“““

From my experience I have found that the Matrox ConvertIP dongles use multiple SRDs even when they don’t need to.

 The media_sender sample application could be updated to handle multiple SRDs in the GPU Direct case.  This would require having an additional GPU buffer and doing a very fast device-to-device CUDA memcpy of each SRD similar to what is done in the non-GPU Direct case.    In the RivermaxViewer and the Unreal Engine ST 2110 plugin we are doing something similar to this in order to remove the holes in the GPU Direct Payload data.  The media_receiver sample works well when the payload size is known in this case 1200 and there are no holes in the data.  But to hand the more generic case the GPU buffers registered to Rivermax must accommodate the max un-extended UDP payload size of 1460.  In this case there are holes between the actual payload size of each packet and 1460 and in the single SRD case these create rectangles of data that we blit into an additional CUDA buffer using cuMemcpy2D().

We could probably demonstrate how to modify media_receiver to handle all cases of multiple SRDs in the GPU Direct case, but I don’t know if we could make this happen before IBC.



-tom

“““

comments.body:
[~accountid:557058:4220c62a-5a45-4184-9d96-222257e39e44] Assigned to me. First need a screenshot.

Why do you assume Bart can fix it ?
Hope is maybe a better word, [~accountid:557058:5c061ae6-cca4-4531-b7c7-5648da07ddbf]. I’m a simple man, I see NGS-D440, I tag Bart… But open to suggestions.

[~accountid:63d78502010d3563796ff7db] 
Do you have logs?
We need to confirm whether or not YUV 4:2:2 is used, this depends on 2 CTRL system level settings.
[~accountid:61fb7f7eacd4cb0069d0af29] requested logs.

[~accountid:557058:4220c62a-5a45-4184-9d96-222257e39e44] 
The issue is seen at the CTRL output side on a source ingested at the input.
It could be an issue caused by something along that path, at the encoder, at the decoder, or even system/server, related to config, as Bart hints at.

Further, not much can be done by anyone without additonal inputs:

* a screenshot => what do they see
* support file => what is system state/config

There are a number of conditions where playback of a baseband AV source fed in via NGS-D440 is still in 4:2:0 which might explain what they see, as specified:

!image-20260113-141148.png|width=368,alt="image-20260113-141148.png"!

(ideally should have been explained in the train-the-trainer of this feature. Not sure if that was the case)

Do they have OPS decoders in their system, or are they using CTRL to stream NGS-D440 into TFN ?

Or there is still a defect.

Or the advanced 4:2:2 does not meet their needs - which I would deem unlikely, for sure there is a subjective visible difference between 4:2:0 and 4:2:2. If they do not see a difference, then 4:2:2 is most likely not enabled.

[~accountid:557058:5c061ae6-cca4-4531-b7c7-5648da07ddbf] Indeed, I was not aware of these settings requirements.
Also sales was not aware, given that they have this list of projects that still faced this issue after upgrade to 1.12:
DE253401   KW Fenne (Siemens)

[DE252801|https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwebapps.barco.com%2Fcs%2FPiNG3%2FProjects%2FOverview%2FDE252801&data=05%7C02%7Ckevin.quintieri%40barco.com%7C0c2d048618f9407d287808de52adaa7f%7Caeb84c9162704446ada5d71ceba1d535%7C0%7C0%7C639039103013637497%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=EjdRhDozJpyYnNaJ6q7kmIudtIYOPWa%2FHVtUuDZY5mE%3D&reserved=0] STEAG KW Bexbach (Siemens)

DE254702 BGE Asse (Bundesgesellschaft fuer Endlagerung)

[DE252901|https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwebapps.barco.com%2Fcs%2FPiNG3%2FProjects%2FOverview%2FDE252901&data=05%7C02%7Ckevin.quintieri%40barco.com%7C0c2d048618f9407d287808de52adaa7f%7Caeb84c9162704446ada5d71ceba1d535%7C0%7C0%7C639039103013662520%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=i0GJysgVIDcs3SwXjKg7ZzCeuxQH%2BDVURWmeED%2Fa0TU%3D&reserved=0] EnBW KW Altbach (Herglotz)

DE260301 Duisburg HKW 3 (Stadtwerke Duisburg)

DE253601 50 Hertz Offshore - Interims-Leitstelle OOC



I’m uploading logs from the case I have (Opterra) right now.


This is an example for that customer.

!IMG_0109 neu-20260113-143108.png|width=839,alt="IMG_0109 neu-20260113-143108.png"!

Here’s an example from another customer:


!image-20260113-143220.png|width=839,alt="image-20260113-143220.png"!

Just for reference: Bright color on dark background != dark color on bright background.
Is it safe to say that the 2nd picture with dark text on bright background is *not yet* fixed?
(I’m still verifying whether all those projects mentioned above are 22782 (dark text on bright background) rather than this ticket here (bright text on dark background)…

Current state:
Remote Session with customer cancelled. I didn’t receive any feedback whatsoever, so I did all the testing on my setup instead.

I simply opened an excel sheet, made a few cells black and then put random text in different colors in those cells.
It is clear as day that e.g. red text on black background is way more pixelated than light gray.

I then opened the ClearType thingy in windows and “calibrated” my 3 displays. I couldn’t see any difference whatsoever.
Then I just disabled ClearType, which again asked me to calibrate the displays - which I did. Again I couldn’t see any difference whatsoever compared to prior to changing any settings.

Taking a picture from close up to the screen (via phone), it is very clear that those texts the customers complain about are literally more pixelated than the… “clear” text.


!image-20260122-143948.png|width=815,alt="image-20260122-143948.png"!



Furthermore: We’ll receive a new case where a customer reports white lines on black background being “pixelated” on the border between two encoders (mulithead) - started showing up *after* the upgrade to 1.12 only.


!image-20260122-143931.png|width=815,alt="image-20260122-143931.png"!



Assigning back to Unassigned, since this ticket shouldn’t be waiting for me or any customer to progress.
Reproduction is easily done in 10 seconds. 

If this is indeed “just” wrong expectations, we’ll need an official letter explaining this to the customer base.

Do I understand correct that this is now documented and working as expected? Can we expect/achieve further improvements?

[~accountid:557058:5c061ae6-cca4-4531-b7c7-5648da07ddbf] can you clarify status? thx
Indian customer now also reported that while it slightly improved, they are still not happy with it and not accepting this as a solution.

[~accountid:63d78388f1475ad42c575ad2] 
I checked the “Opterra 1.12” logs in sharepoint (barcoctrl.deu01.net_Support_2026-01-13_14.35.54.tar) and found that there encoders are streaming yuv 4:2:2 (as encryption is enable and legacy ops devices are not allowed).
Customer is running CTRL 1.12.
Could you try to reproduce the issue ([https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-24101?focusedCommentId=1553510|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-24101?focusedCommentId=1553510|smart-link] ), check whether or not Stijn’s suggestions
[https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-24101?focusedCommentId=1451600|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-24101?focusedCommentId=1451600|smart-link] help, and check that the improved chroma upsampling is active in this case.

AFAIR you mentionned that the advanced chroma upsampling was only applied when not scaling? Is that correct? Could that maybe (partially) explain the issue persisting, even with yuv 4:2:2 enabled?

[~accountid:61fb7f7eacd4cb0069d0af29]  I am actively checking all the possibilties  and cases where this may still show the issue. For original source size and upscled this advanced chroma algo will work but not for downscaled. Currently investigating .

Current analysis shows that the 422 stream from D440 is subpar, indicating degraded luma/chroma that affects text and image quality. The scaler/color space converter on the D440 board fails to subsample or apply filters correctly, resulting in weaker colors. Subsampling should not downsample luma. We are next investigating the onboard Xilinx (Video Processing Subsystem) for a solution.

Providing YUV (422) HDMI input to D440 allows SAN to render perfectly, utilizing advanced algorithms for accurate upsampling. Attached are reference images showing both RGB and YUV422 final output raw images from SAN.

In the meantime, verify if client devices (GPU/hardware/Intel/NVIDIA) support YUV422 output to see if this resolves the issue and achieves the desired result. This will also confirm if our efforts to configure the Video Processor correctly are on the right track. In the sharepoint final raw output from SAN, compare YUV422 and RGB input to D440, and check Intel graphics settings for configuration. Nvidia may have a different dialog. [~accountid:61fb7f7eacd4cb0069d0af29] [~accountid:63d78502010d3563796ff7db]

[~accountid:63d78388f1475ad42c575ad2] I did a quick check via Google, to find more information on Nvidia and 4:2:2
It seems like Nvidia only supports 4:2:2 on the RTX5xxx Series.
The Quadro RTX4000 for example, which we use for our NSDs, does *not* support 4:2:2.
The P4000, on the other hand, supports 4:2:2.

I’ll reach out to the customers to see if their systems support 4:2:2 output.

[~accountid:63d78502010d3563796ff7db] Additionally, a better option is to choose Full Quantization in RGB only, as the default is LIMITED due to the inherent restrictions of consumer electronics timings. However, for pure color graphics/ text , selecting FULL RANGE RGB improves text quality.  

!Screenshot 2026-01-29 152346.png|width=1061,alt="Screenshot 2026-01-29 152346.png"!

[~accountid:63d78502010d3563796ff7db] 
I updated the root cause accordingly.

Here’s a relevant KB: [https://www.barco.com/en/support/knowledge-base/14870-barco-ctrl-color-and-brightness-difference-on-san-050-showing-ngs-d440-sources|https://www.barco.com/en/support/knowledge-base/14870-barco-ctrl-color-and-brightness-difference-on-san-050-showing-ngs-d440-sources]
This explains how to set the rgb quantization range and how to check what the encoder is getting.

[~accountid:61fb7f7eacd4cb0069d0af29] 

[~accountid:63d78388f1475ad42c575ad2] 
Thanks a lot!
The KB shows screenshots from the d440 diagnostics.
Before reaching out to the customer, can you verify that their streams are in fact *not* configured for FULL?

[~accountid:63d78502010d3563796ff7db]  [~accountid:61fb7f7eacd4cb0069d0af29]    In the optera folder copied on {{2026-01-13}} (barcoctrl.deu01.net_Support_2026-01-13_14.35.54)  Following is the findings. with 2 NGS with HDM1 connected with LIMITED range. 

!Findings.png|width=510,alt="Findings.png"!

We have fixed the handling of LIMITED Range RGB in the kernel driver for the Color Space Converter, allowing our 422 decoder algorithm to function correctly. However, FULL RANGE RGB still offers better color depth due to some loss during the (FULL->LIMITED->FULL) downscaling and upscaling.

[https://github.com/barcoemu/CA-xlnx-linux/commit/8d926faeaec053297b7b347317f7705af4e6a583|https://github.com/barcoemu/CA-xlnx-linux/commit/8d926faeaec053297b7b347317f7705af4e6a583]

[~accountid:63d78388f1475ad42c575ad2] when fix is/was merged into product, can you put to resolved and add sprint build number of master into the fixversion ? So we can check this made it into 1.14 once we create release branch and branch-off from master.

[~accountid:557058:5c061ae6-cca4-4531-b7c7-5648da07ddbf] 
I’m about to make a PR to ctrl develop with the fix, bump got delayed due to other work.
=> [https://github.com/barcoemu/ocs-ctrl-system-ci/pull/3018|https://github.com/barcoemu/ocs-ctrl-system-ci/pull/3018|smart-link]

fields.customfield_10046:
* implement in-range proportional bucket chroma upsampling (if customer accepts resulting quality)
* (+ ngs-d440 streams 4:2:2 iso 4:2:0)
fields.customfield_10047:
* 4:2:0 upsampling algorithm in SAN decoder not able to reconstruct bright text on black background in qualitative manner
* Xilinx csc driver doesn’t distinguish between rgb limited and full quantization range and assumes full range input.

For consumer electronics (CE) timings, default quantization range is limited.
For IT timings, default quantization range is full.
So for rgb → yuv 4:2:2/4:2:0 conversion to yield expected quality, atm, you need to input full range rgb.
This usually can be configured from your video card config application.
For desktop usage, in fact user should always explicitly configure to full range for best color fidelity.

Alternatively, you can configure the PC to output yuv 4:4:4 or yuv 4:2:2, so we bypass color space conversion.

More info: see [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-22598|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-22598|smart-link]

comments.body:
We see that HDMIIn1 → HDMIOut loopthrough also sometimes fails on ngs-d440 setup 2.
When it fails, pixelclock looks fine and loopthrough can be recovered by issuing a hotplug from the mna-440 encoder,
which doesn’t touch the pixelclock on the d440, but only causes a hdmi tx ss stream down followed by stream up callback.
Remains to be seen if this is an issue in mna-440 hdmi rx or this is caused by an issue on d440, e.g. trigging clk rdy too soon.

Toggling tmds181 output in mna-440 can fix or break the video: i2cset -y -f 0 0x5e 0x09 0x0a && sleep 0.1 && i2cset -y -f 0 0x5e 0x09 0x02.
This has no effect on ngs-d440, so remaining issue is in mna-440.

fields.customfield_10047:
automated reproduction: [macludatesting/ngs_dxx0/test_video.py: mna-440 hdmi enc stress test (… · barcoemu/ocs-media-macluda-test@d07cbae|https://github.com/barcoemu/ocs-media-macluda-test/commit/d07cbae410c322df2b5a0fdca28796002203ebcf]

# Not configuring idt5p49 vco ref clk within vco range for loopthrough on ngs-d440 
# Signal integrity issue/timing detection issue:
Can fix the video by simulating clk_tx_unprepare() → clk_tx_prepare() fixes on ngs-d440.
Can fix the video by applying tx changes in tmds181 in mna-440 (i2cset -y -f 0 0x5e 0x09 0x0a && sleep 0.1 && i2cset -y -f 0 0x5e 0x09 0x02), this has no effect on ngs-d440, so issue lies within mna-440 hdmi enc → [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/MI0774-159?focusedCommentId=1562164|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/MI0774-159?focusedCommentId=1562164|smart-link]

Mult : 12 - Div : 1 - Clk0Div : 6 - Clk1Div : 12 - Clk2Div : 6

+*Tx Ref Clk: 130516992 Hz*+

Notice how the tx ref clock percieved by the hdmi vphy doesn’t match the expected pixel clock, so it seems like something is going wrong in the beluga_idt driver.
Perhaps the clock ready signal is toggled too soon after setting up hdmi rx clock loopthrough.
This might be a regression caused by a recent change to always calibrate the vco after changing ref clock, even through we’re not actively using the vco, which was necessary to fix a production stop due to renesas silently changing factory default register settings in recent batches.
Perhaps now we should first poll for the expected clock to be stable for some time before issuing a clock ready.

comments.body:
[~accountid:63d78391a5d0c82630686b49] Hi Lisbeth, is there an easy way to detect the difference between control cycle number and a Kanban number. 

Based on this BMOP can maybe autodetect which Kanban type to trigger (“event driven by control cylce” or “classic Kanban by <kanbanID> & 2“)

related design see [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/OperationsDigital/pages/352141520/Pull+MVP+Kanban?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiMDliMjg4ZGE1MTZiNDVlYzk3ZWNhYjJiZmMzNDY1MzIiLCJwIjoiYyJ9|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/OperationsDigital/pages/352141520/Pull+MVP+Kanban?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiMDliMjg4ZGE1MTZiNDVlYzk3ZWNhYjJiZmMzNDY1MzIiLCJwIjoiYyJ9|smart-link]

[~accountid:63d782bac3eb74ad8e94b04e] Proposal:

* add to “Manunfacturing Experience API”
* can we combine this with current REST API “Create Kaban Event” or do we create new one ?
* !image-20260130-102720.png|width=709,alt="image-20260130-102720.png"!

[~accountid:63d782bac3eb74ad8e94b04e] 

# Can you share the design requirements for Mulesoft team? 
# Which parameter will be used in the REST-API call?
# Which kind of error handeling will be implemented?
[~accountid:63d782bac3eb74ad8e94b04e] Can you add the Servicenow ID to this Jira comments as reference? This to report back the integration topics we may have at first use.

Hallo

 

Design is simpel, gewoon doorgeven van 2 velden naar de bapi , no middleware logic om het future proof te maken (ref as same logic van de vorige kanban api)

Input

Kanbanid : NUM (bv 123456)

Nextstatus : CHAR (bv 2)

 

Return

Het standaard SAP antwoord wordt doorgegeven als return

 

Dat alles in JSON/REST

 

Groeten

Nico

fields.description:
* Kortrijk revamp plan is to start (April) using “Classic Kanban” on workplaces with BMOP instead of the event driven Kanban (based on control cycle scanning). 
* The classic Kanban trigger will be based on a operator scanning of Kanban barcode. The value scanned = KANBANID number extended with digit 2 (=KANBANID>+2)
* A Mulesoft REST AÏ will be designed by SWIT available end FEB
* Mulesoft API will give error message back when API is called to many times in function of maximum defined kanban BINs (like max 3 BINs). Good to show this to operator (“max bin requests exceeded - Mxx material kanban al ready in request)

Orginal schedule request: 

* Revamp planning:
** Fase 1: Netwerking start 7/04/26
** Fase 2: SA + FA
** Fase 3: Cleanroom + rest

comments.body:
+Open questions:+

* Implementing extreme black within dynablack limits the usage of that feature to those products that support dynablack. Is that ok or not?
* What are the expectations of PM for extreme black? Is it purely seen as a contrast improvement or also to be used for power saving purposes? E.g. if my projector has no signal and no signal pattern is set to blue than extreme black will not be usable to turn of the light source completely upon no signal detection.
* If we implement extreme black within dynamic contrast it becomes less predictable how long it takes to turn off the lasers completely upon black detection, because the time it takes dynablack to dim to minimum power depends on the histogram. (previous image contents before black) If we implement it as it used to be for lady Gaga, the maximum time it takes to turn of the lasers is defined (but the actual time may be shorter, depending on the actual laser power at the start of dimming.

Final decision was made on the implementation type, the functionality will be considered separate from dynablack.
So the user must have control over the time it takes to dim to black and shutoff and the threshold for the grey value.

fields.description:
After another deliberation session it became very apparent that the previously not required features of:

*Lights Out Timer:*
Set a timer for the laser light to turn off after detecting black content.
The set value ranges from 0s to 20s.

*Lights Out Signal Level:*
Set a black level value as the threshold for the Real Black function.
The value can be selected from 0 to 255, with 0 being the darkest black and 255 being the brightest.

Are hard requirements.

----

This fights with the current design, where it is not transparent to the user how long it will take for the shutter to close once black content starts arriving.
As the time till shutter would depend on the current “level of dimming“. Additionally it was noted that the current dynblack is very slow and so it would take a long time to take effect.

Can we design a system that allows both, or perhaps we can adapt the originally provided system to allow for forcing shutter of when dynablack ?

comments.body:
[PQM] Ranking on top of backlog since potentially we have a lot of backups in the field that don’t actually work… Hopefully a quick fix to accept the password.

Note: we should also check which other characters give issues!
This issue only happened when we use '$' more than once in the password

h3. Root Cause

The issue occurs when passwords contain shell special characters such as {{$}}, {{$$}}, backticks ({{`}}), or {{!}}. These characters are interpreted by the underlying operating system shell instead of being treated as normal text. As a result, the password that the system actually uses is different from what the user entered.

Some concrete examples:

* {{$variable}}
The shell treats this as an environment variable.
** Example: {{AVW$support1}}
If {{support1}} is not a defined variable, {{$support1}} is replaced with an empty string, so the password effectively becomes {{AVW}}.
* {{$$}}
The shell replaces {{$$}} with the current process ID (PID).
** Example: {{AVW$$support1}}
During (download), {{$$}} is replaced with one PID, so the password becomes {{AVW<PID1>support1}}.
During (upload), a different shell process runs with a different PID, so {{$$}} becomes {{AVW<PID2>support1}}.
Because {{<PID1> ≠ <PID2>}}, the system sees these as different passwords and the operation fails.
* {{`command`}}
Text between backticks is executed as a shell command, and its output is substituted into the password. This can change the password unpredictably and is also a potential security risk.

Because of this shell expansion, the password stored or used internally does not match the one the customer expects, leading to authentication mismatches


*Proposed fix:*
We will no longer pass the user‑provided password directly into a shell command line where it can be expanded. Instead, we will treat the password as a *pure data string*

*Impact on existing backups / backward compatibility*:

Existing backups that were created *before this fix* and whose passwords contained shell‑special constructs (e.g. {{$VAR}}, {{$$}}, {{`cmd`}}), For such previously created backups, the password that was internally used at creation time cannot be reproduced reliably (e.g. different PID at upload time), so those specific backups will still fail to restore even after we fix the implementation.

* Today, those backups only work “by accident” because the shell transforms the password (e.g. {{AVW$$support1}} becomes {{AVW<PID>support1}}).
* After the fix, the system will use the *literal* password exactly as typed by the user, without shell substitution.

CC: [~accountid:557058:85b9f1e1-a89e-4572-99ed-838906d54129] , [~accountid:557058:d62807bc-ead8-4dd3-a387-0d271329117c]

Adding [~accountid:712020:e7d31fd3-7f23-4a89-b826-ad17642a3886] [~accountid:712020:e059e4aa-65e1-4218-aabc-6970656f34ef] [~accountid:712020:b33591a5-091a-4dca-bf26-45330ee93b71] 

IMO this is a real security issue and enables *Shell command injection* as well, I tried a few things together with Ranjan

The password {{A1$(whoami)}} becomes {{A1root}}, so we can essentially execute any command inside Gwendolyn docker. I also tested it by deleting the log files using {{A1$(rm -rf /var/log/*)}} password.

cc: [~accountid:557058:4220c62a-5a45-4184-9d96-222257e39e44] [~accountid:5d6d235fab129d0c306d8108] [~accountid:712020:8b3227a8-de06-456d-a6e1-f6507b7e0867]

1) +*Customer : US240604 / FPL ICC UniSee / AV-WORX*+

SF case : 00569378

 

h3. Actual behavior

Integrator reports that password AVW$$support1  can be set for backup download without complains but uploading and password authentication reports invalid passwords.



Seems there is a problem with $$.

Password AVW$support1 with one $ works.

User login with password containing $$ works as well.



Tested with 1.12.0 release version and 1.13.0-31 on my test system



We a similar problem (user login, not backup) in Video wall Manager which is much more strange  : [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/TSM0109-26373|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/TSM0109-26373|smart-link] 



Attached is a backup file from my test system with password AVW$$support1

comments.body: [~accountid:5d427f60e4777b0db2f0e1c5] , this ticket should not go to Fruitesse project?? and then pick it up, priority-wise, do you think this is a P1 or P2?

[~accountid:61eacb05b134e800703cf52d] , I moved it to Fruitesse project. I have no idea about the priority, but informed Clint and Bob. The plan is end of this year.

And means the CNI feature on button is not fully complete.
Asked [~accountid:557058:07b70cbc-0357-47a5-bd3d-a3b2f4350830] to add some comments. Unsure if we expect Squid to still look at issues like this, but I would appreciate his insights.

It could be that the requested cipher is not supported by the Button GEN5. We should be able to check this with the wpa_supplicant log.

We can also check the ciphers supported by the button by sniffing an EAP-TLS handshake between a Button GEN5 and an WPA3 AP. I will check to prepare such setup in KOR office.



For reference, below, the list of ciphers supported by Button GEN5 on a EAP-TLS WPA2 AP:

!image-20260127-090813.png|width=890,alt="image-20260127-090813.png"!

From my current understanding (I would need the wpa_supplicant log for confirmation), the Aruba AP is using cipher “TLS_AES_128_CCM_SHA256” ([https://ciphersuite.info/cs/TLS_AES_128_CCM_SHA256/|https://ciphersuite.info/cs/TLS_AES_128_CCM_SHA256/|smart-link]) which is not supported by the button (at least from a WPA2 EAP-TLS AP capture).

We should check how to add it in the Fruitesse openssl configuration (adding the missing ciphers to [https://github.com/barcoclickshare/mx-common-openssl-config/blob/master/openssl.cnf#L23|https://github.com/barcoclickshare/mx-common-openssl-config/blob/master/openssl.cnf#L23]  ?)

[~accountid:557058:07b70cbc-0357-47a5-bd3d-a3b2f4350830]  here is the logs try to connect to TestRoom-WPA3-EAP128 or TestRoom-WPA3-EAP256

[^260128journalctl_eap256_wpa.log]
[^260128_journalctl_eap128_wpa.log]

If you want and have TeamViewer. I think I can setup an environment for you to remote debug and access our SSID.

[~accountid:557058:07b70cbc-0357-47a5-bd3d-a3b2f4350830]

New logs.

[^260128-2_journalctl_eap-tls-256.log]
[^260128-2_journalctl_eap-tls-128.log]

[~accountid:5d427f60e4777b0db2f0e1c5] , thanks for these now logs

Log analyzis:

*260128-2_journalctl_eap-tls-256.log*

Passive scanning for SSID:

{noformat}Nov 06 11:11:36 ButtonGen5-001200602688 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[1659]: passive_scan=1
Nov 06 11:11:36 ButtonGen5-001200602688 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[1659]: Priority group 0
Nov 06 11:11:36 ButtonGen5-001200602688 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[1659]:    id=0 ssid='TestRoom-WPA3-EAP256'{noformat}

SSID seen but network setting mismatch

{noformat}Nov 06 11:11:41 ButtonGen5-001200602688 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[1659]: wlan0: 15: 3c:e8:6e:16:67:b5 ssid='TestRoom-WPA3-EAP256' wpa_ie_len=0 rsn_ie_len=26 caps=0x111 level=-64 freq=5260
Nov 06 11:11:41 ButtonGen5-001200602688 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[1659]: wlan0:    skip RSN IE - key mgmt mismatch
Nov 06 11:11:41 ButtonGen5-001200602688 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[1659]: wlan0:    skip - MFP Required but network not MFP Capable{noformat}

→ “MFP” means “Management Frame Protection”

So, it looks like the Button GEN5 refuses to connect to this AP because the Button GEN5 +requires management frame protection+ to be enabled and the AP does not.

*TODO*: check in the association request from the Button if MFP is effectively mandatory

*260128-2_journalctl_eap-tls-128.log*

Passive scanning for SSID:

{noformat}Nov 06 11:11:36 ButtonGen5-001200602688 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[1702]: passive_scan=1
Nov 06 11:11:36 ButtonGen5-001200602688 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[1702]: Priority group 0
Nov 06 11:11:36 ButtonGen5-001200602688 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[1702]:    id=0 ssid='TestRoom-WPA3-EAP256'--> Looks this {noformat}

→ looks button was still paired to previous SSID
[~accountid:5d427f60e4777b0db2f0e1c5] , would you know if the “Management Frame Protection” is enabled at AP side ?

[~accountid:557058:07b70cbc-0357-47a5-bd3d-a3b2f4350830] 

I confirmed MFP is enabled for all 3 SSIDs.

The only difference is key management.

!image-20260129-033633.png|width=401,alt="image-20260129-033633.png"!

Not sure if the root cause issue is the same but I get the same “error” message during scanning when I tried to let my Button GEN5 associate with my new home router (Proximus “Internet Box V1”):

{noformat}Jan 26 00:00:36 ButtonGen5-001200602398 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[2105]: wlan0: 0: 12:2b:aa:34:a4:10 ssid='Proximus-Limited-xxxxxx' wpa_ie_len=0 rsn_ie_len=20 caps=0x1411 level=-59 freq=2462  wps
Jan 26 00:00:36 ButtonGen5-001200602398 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[2105]: wlan0:    skip RSN IE - key mgmt mismatch
Jan 26 00:00:36 ButtonGen5-001200602398 custom-wpa-supplicant-start.sh[2105]: wlan0:    skip - MFP Required but network not MFP Capable{noformat}

Hello [~accountid:5d427f60e4777b0db2f0e1c5],

Please could you also check if OWE (Opportunistic Wireless Encryption) is automatically enabled on the Aruba AP when you select ciphers GCM256 or CCM128 ?

Apparently, OWE (also called Enhanced Open) can be enabled/disabled in the way described at [https://arubanetworking.hpe.com/techdocs/Instant_8.x_WebHelp/Content/instant-ug/authentication/enhanced-open.htm#:~:text=Navigate%20to%20the%20WLAN,these%20commands%20to%20appropriate%20functions.|https://arubanetworking.hpe.com/techdocs/Instant_8.x_WebHelp/Content/instant-ug/authentication/enhanced-open.htm#:~:text=Navigate%20to%20the%20WLAN,these%20commands%20to%20appropriate%20functions.|smart-link] 

Thanks in advance

Hi [~accountid:557058:07b70cbc-0357-47a5-bd3d-a3b2f4350830],

I check in config page again. I didn’t find which item is related to OWE can enable/disable.

fields.description:
The SSID is configured using an Aruba AP‑755 access point. In the WPA3 EAP‑TLS security settings, there are three key‑management options available: *CNSA*, *CCM 128*, and *GCM 256*.
+*Currently, the Gen5 Button is unable to connect to SSIDs when the access point is configured to require CCM 128 or GCM 256, CNSA is working fine.*+ However, the same SSIDs can be successfully connected using both Windows and macOS clients. This indicates that the issue is likely on the Button side.

h1. Environment

In TAIPEI 33F

SSID:

* TestRoom-WPA3-EAP
** Key management: CNSA
* TestRoom-WPA3-EAP128
** Key management: GCM 128
* TestRoom-WPA3-EAP256 
** key management: GCM 256

h2. *Test Step*

# config button with correct pairing config (EPA-TLS SSID) via button-control-cli
{noformat}# configs need to set
button-control-cli.exe --caCrt <BUTTON CA> --clientCrt <BUTTON CRT> --clientKey <BUTTON PRIVKEY> --usbproduct 0x01B5 --usbusage 0x02 --usbusagepage 0xFF00 --setCniEnabled "true"
button-control-cli.exe --caCrt <BUTTON CA> --clientCrt <BUTTON CRT> --clientKey <BUTTON PRIVKEY> --usbproduct 0x01B5 --usbusage 0x02 --usbusagepage 0xFF00 --setSSID <EAP SSID>
button-control-cli.exe --caCrt <BUTTON CA> --clientCrt <BUTTON CRT> --clientKey <BUTTON PRIVKEY> --usbproduct 0x01B5 --usbusage 0x02 --usbusagepage 0xFF00 --setAuthenticationMode "wsaAuth_WPA3_EAP_TLS"
button-control-cli.exe --caCrt <BUTTON CA> --clientCrt <BUTTON CRT> --clientKey <BUTTON PRIVKEY> --usbproduct 0x01B5 --usbusage 0x02 --usbusagepage 0xFF00 --setNetworkEAPIdentity <EAP IDENTITY>
button-control-cli.exe --caCrt <BUTTON CA> --clientCrt <BUTTON CRT> --clientKey <BUTTON PRIVKEY> --usbproduct 0x01B5 --usbusage 0x02 --usbusagepage 0xFF00 --setNetworkEAPKeyPassword <EAP KEY PASSWORD>
button-control-cli.exe --caCrt <BUTTON CA> --clientCrt <BUTTON CRT> --clientKey <BUTTON PRIVKEY> --usbproduct 0x01B5 --usbusage 0x02 --usbusagepage 0xFF00 --fileTransferName CACert --fileTransferPath <PEM file> --timeout 5
button-control-cli.exe --caCrt <BUTTON CA> --clientCrt <BUTTON CRT> --clientKey <BUTTON PRIVKEY> --usbproduct 0x01B5 --usbusage 0x02 --usbusagepage 0xFF00 --fileTransferName PrivateKey --fileTransferPath <PFX file> --timeout 5{noformat}
{noformat}# one example in this scenario from --getPairingConfig
application.operation_mode - dp_simpleusb
application.logLevel - osa_logging_info
application.content_audio_enable -
application.shared_secret -
application.lastPairingEpoch -

application.baseunit_serial -
connection.meetingRoomName -
connection.meetingRoomLocation -
network.ssid - TestRoom-WPA3-EAP
network.passPhrase -
network.authentication - wsaAuth_WPA3_EAP_TLS
network.eapPassword -

network.eapAnonymousIdentity -
network.eapKeyPassword - clickshare
network.freqList - 5640
network.baseIP -
network.baseHostname -
network.baseLanMacAddress -
network.mode -

network.cniEnabled - true
systemload.iperf_test_udp -
systemload.iperf_duration(sec) -
systemload.iperf_test_server -
systemload.systemload_led_scenario -
systemload.systemload_tx_power -
getPairingConfig - Success{noformat}
# Reboot button
# Verify button gets the IP via “adb shell ifconfig wlan0“

comments.body: I’ve reviewed the described QCA SDK upgrade scope and related repos. No concerns from my side, OK to go ahead with the update.
The purpose of this task is to intake the QCA WiFi SDK 35.3 which will be used in Delirium Kernel 6.1

Hi [~accountid:5c950acbba0e1b2d0ec993ae] 

The [https://chipcode.qti.qualcomm.com|https://chipcode.qti.qualcomm.com.] only contains the Qualcomm proprietary code. 
The [+https://git.codelinaro.org+|https://git.codelinaro.org] is the safe website for storing open-source components required for building the QCA2066 WiFi SDK. These 7 repos are required to sync back to Barco github.
You can have a reference from the bring up guide:


!image-20260209-085521.png|width=894,alt="image-20260209-085521.png"!

Let me know if you have concerns 🙂
Hi [~accountid:5c950acbba0e1b2d0ec993ae],  could you proceed with syncing the external repos when you get a chance? Thanks!

fields.description:
We are upgrading the Delirium kernel, which requires a corresponding upgrade of the QCA SDK to a matching version.

The QCA SDK upgrade must follow Qualcomm's technical approach. The relevant repositories include:

# *qca2066-10*: Already updated. The rest are submodules and have not yet been updated.
# *core_tech_modules*      
Outside link: [https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/external-wlan/wlan-cnss-core.git|https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/external-wlan/wlan-cnss-core.git]
# *qcacld-3.0*      
Outside link: [https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/external-wlan/qcacld-3.0.git|https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/external-wlan/qcacld-3.0.git]
# *qca-wifi-host-cmn*      
Outside link: [https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/external-wlan/qca-wifi-host-cmn.git|https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/external-wlan/qca-wifi-host-cmn.git]
# *fw-api*      
Outside link: [https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/external-wlan/fw-api.git|https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/external-wlan/fw-api.git]
# *sigma_dut*      
Outside link: [https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/la/platform/vendor/qcom-opensource/wlan/utils/sigma-dut.git|https://git.codelinaro.org/clo/la/platform/vendor/qcom-opensource/wlan/utils/sigma-dut.git]
# *hostap*      
Outside link: [http://w1.fi/hostap.git|http://w1.fi/hostap.git]

For details, refer to Qualcomm's reply email.

!图片-20260209-062421.png|width=630,height=813!

*The target repositories need to be updated to their latest state, including tag information.*

Please review it. [~accountid:712020:1021aaaf-600a-4d71-b546-b91ffe04dd16] [~accountid:61eacba498cd610070718e32] [~accountid:61eacb9378cb690071756a6f] [~accountid:61eac9fbe2261a0069575beb]      
And [~accountid:5c950acbba0e1b2d0ec993ae], proceed with the operation.

This chart tracks the weekly success rate of room connections, indicating accessibility and stability.{color:#bf2600} {color}{color:#bf2600}*Tracking applies only to devices running Button App or Desktop App (>V4.47).*{color}

Gen5 Button Accessibility (%) = Successful Connected to BU / All Attempted Connection

|DVT2|* Pro: 1882000072~1882000093, 1882000191~1882000198, 1882000357~1882000372, 1882000375~1882000427, 1882000429~1882000433

This fits in scope of [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-16772|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-16772|smart-link] 

Linked it to that epic as parent. The fit criteria of that epic already cover for resolving this ticket.

[~accountid:63d7859cfb75f8568f5e8da4] This issue is no longer applicable with the new implementation ([+OCS0001-16772+|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-16772]). With SAN‑050, only a single UHD is supported. This has been verified on version 1.13.0‑34.

[~accountid:712020:9c503295-345a-4e8c-b54d-c502b1030d72] [~accountid:640f05acb05b4e3e7da841d8]

fields.customfield_10046:
From a UX point of view we believe it is not that easy to generate a logic that is always right as we have already 4 HW flavor if we add OpSpace hardware and there are also a lot of other monitors being used (especially 1440 widescreens). So selecting the right resolution for each screen from the offered edid that is compatible with the decoder and offers the right aspect ratio and refresh may be tricky.
Hence we propose with the better feedback we are offering the user ([+OCS0001-16772+|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/browse/OCS0001-16772]) it is OK for the user to select himself which timing he/she wants for the monitor or to re-cable to get the preferred timing of the monitor.
The user will need to make this choice once pr SAN.
However to avoid repetitive work we would again propose to introduce desk templates. 
That way this choice needs to only be made once for the 1st desk and not for the subsequent desks.
Most controlrooms only have 1-3 desk layouts, a template can be made for each of those desk layouts

fields.description:
h3. Actual behavior

Based on [https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/issues/OCS0001-24136|https://barco-nv.atlassian.net/issues/OCS0001-24136] (KRLA: would not link it to what is happening on the encoder) 

Same issue for SAN-050:
When you connect 2 displays to one SAN-050, 
you can not use UHD.

-Displays connected to the same san have to be the same resolution.

-one SAN-050 can only do 1 x UHD. (KRLA: OPS-220 can do 2 4k)

h3. Occurrence rate

Always

h3. Workaround (If any)

Manually select FHD 60.
